It's OK adding pointless extras like social media, which in my opinion is one reason why football is heading down the toilet, but until they address the pathetic match engine it will never improve. Same story as every other incarnation - having 30-40 shots per game and failing to score more than a couple of goals, whereas opposition score from almost every chance, inexplicable decision making, clunky wooden player movements.... same old, same old.Still, when idiots like me continue to buy it, they don't need to invest to improve it, do they?!I get that it is a simulation game, and its about the strategy not the graphics. But nothing that happens when you watch the game is reflective of the instructions given to players, so it would be better to remove the match simulation if they aren't willing to improve it. 'Run at defence', 'hit early crosses', 'cross from deep' may as well be removed, because the players never do any of them. A personal favourite is seeing your player shoot (usually from a ridiculous angle) and it gets blocked by a defender, then ricochets back into your own six yard box!! Are these players made out of concrete?!The decisions players make are laughable; apparently world class players shooting from impossible angles, hitting shots straight at the goalkeeper instead of squaring it to an unmarked team-mate, and playing suicide passes across the front of their back four are evident numerous times in every game.Aside from the match engine, there is also very little scope for digging out a bargain. In FM19, it was possibly too easy to pick up young, cheap players who would go on to become stars, but this version has gone to the other extreme. You find a half-decent youngster playing for a village team in Nigeria, and his club want Â£25m for him. Again, they just can't get the balance right. What is desperately required is a rival game, ideally made by people who understand football. The makers of FM have become lazy and complacent as despite how bad the game continues to be, there is very little competition in this space.

Some of the new stuff such as the club vision and development centre are nice additions, but as has been said in countless reviews so far, the match engine is tedious at best. The number of one on ones missed or saved is what really ruins the game for me, the players trying to shoot from the byline or wingers shooting from a tight angle when there is someone in the centre free is just the cherry on the cake and I don't like cherries so it just compounds the misery for me.The transfer system is as standard, a player you own is worth say 10mil, a club will offer 8 and said player will be upset that you reject the offer. A player another clubs owns is worth 10mil, they want 30mil and no ones bats an eyelash when you refuse to pay it.The game feels like it is missing something, it feels pretty one dimensional now, it has a drop down box for the role when a club offers you a job, but you can only ever be a manager, it seems as though SI thought about putting things like head coaches and interim managers in, but decided not to, which is a shame as it could have been tied into the club vision quite nicely, with some clubs operating where you are the head coach and have little to no say in your TD or DOF appointments as well as the transfers, which does happen at some clubs.I feel at some point SI will have to be bold at some point and offer the user a chance to be a reserve manager, academy manager or a director of football, as there is only so much they can do and rehash every year before it well and truly becomes stale, which if they continue down the path they have for the last few editions, could be in the near future.But overall, it is not THAT far off, its needing some system tweaks, but like I said, at some point, SI will have to make a bold move

I felt I had to write this review despite my limited time playing the game since I have a major problem with it, that I want to warn people about before buying it.My computer more than fits the requirement to run this game - it's not a very demanding game by any means. Yet I find that everything is laggish/sluggish, not just the match engine, but the menus too. It's like everything is running in slight slowmotion that throws you off.I looked up potential solutions and noted that people had found that downloading custom skins could solve the problem - and it did for many people. Sadly not for me, though. And besides, you shouldn't have to rely on 3rd party items to solve something as basic as perfomance. Until the performance is fixed I cannot recommend this game. You most likely (?) wont run into this problem, but even if it's only a fraction of us it's unacceptable when the game costs 55 euros.

I'd start this by ensuring you that I play the game since 1999 and I loved and also hated it ever since, despite the match engine is broken EVER SINCE! I played nearly every iteration in the last 20 years. I just can't understand why nobody could fix the match engine like ever. Below I tell you some examples for FM2020:I play Dortmund right now, but the same thing happens with mostly all the teams I tried to manage...1. Magic goal at the last second of the game:Sometimes when the match engine realises that I'm having a better result that (according some hidden rule) I should have, then it corrects itself with a last second goal for the opposing team. It's really last second, so there's no replay, only the match ends and I realise on the scoreline that I lost. (there was also no scoring chance, or passes before, it just happens out of thin air) That bug can really break something deeply inside me...2. My players are having a bad day:This issue goes back a long time now, it existed more or less in every iterations of FM. If the RNG generates a bad number for you before the match then you CANNOT win. I've tried to reload the match as long as I got bored (after an hour or so) and every single time I've lost against a much weaker team. (maybe a few draws) I had like 3x the chances yet my players magically forgot how to score. I hit all the posts and crossbar 10 times, the rest goes over or their goalkeeper gets a 8.5 result after saving EVERYTHING. Then the other team goes once inside my box, and they score one from EVERY chance. This is also ridiculous.2/b: I think that decision before the match is a real thing, as for example competition draws are decided BEFORE the draw. I checked it by saving on the draw day but BEFORE the draw itself. The I reloaded and drew again getting the same exact result over and over again. I getting to belive that matches work about the same. They are decided before, and "simulation" is only eyecandy, but the result (win or loose) is mostly decided before. You can only change in the match how bad it will be...3. Teams play better with 10 man as with 11:Also goes back a long time with FM. You are getting a good amount of chances and faring ok in the match maybe even leading by 1-2 goals. Then the opposite team looses a man with red card. After that they magically turn into 10 Messies and beat you up with no chance to counter them. Even if you switch to DEFENSIVE AGAINST A 10 MAN TEAM!! If on theother hand YOU loose a man you are as good as dead, they destroy you...4. Opposing players magically learn to play football in the middle of the match:You are getting massive amount of chances and really destroy the opposite team leading by 2-3 goals easily. Then something happens and the opposite team comes back into the game in 10 minutes. If you are lucky you can maybe still win, or draw by the skin of your teeth, but it's often turning into a draw or loss. I've checked, they didn't change tactic or stg. They just learned how to beat me in 10 minutes. 5. Equalizing from kick-off after goal:You score a goal, and the opposite team equalises from the kick off after 2 touches. I'm getting this in 2-3 out of 5 games.Right now this 5 things annony me really after my last couple of matches, but I'm sure I could come up with 5 more if I weren't really pissed off.All-in-all in this state of match engine you need to be a real fan of the game (like me) to play it, otherwise you will start to hate it for the rest of your life. I still hope that it will somehow be fixed, and I can really play it like it was meant to be, but in it's current state I cannot recommend you to buy and play the game. Wait until it will be fixed (if ever).Update: Right after writing the report:https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1938497356

There are times where this game screws you over. There are times when you want to give up on playing it because the simulation can screw with you to the point where you don't believe that it's possible to be screwed over any more. For example, Barcelona + Pogba + Sancho losing to a team like Mallorca 3-0, while Barcelona gets 2 shots the whole 90min. Then there are times where your team, that you spent hours putting together, actually comes together and plays to expectations. That's what's so satisfying about this game. Building a team of young stars and old ones that can compete against the best teams and come out victorious. Overall, for this game to enjoyable you have to actually spend some time building up a team, meaning multiple seasons not just one. If you think you can spend time on a single game for hours at a time, and you enjoy building a football team into your own vision, then you should definitely give this a try. Even if you choose to refund it at 2hrs.

Off and on I have been a player of Football Manager and before that Championship Manager for a number of years, this is the first time for a while I have decided to return to the full version of the game rather than the touch version.I have really tried to like this game but it only really ever serves to frustrate, most of the problems with this game I feel revolve around the match engine. I cannot even begin to estimate how many times I have dominated games in possession, shots & shots on target yet suffered defeat. On a very frequent basis I see my team generating well over twenty shots and over ten on target yet lose the game to a team generating only 2 or 3 shots. I recall this being a football manager curse over many seasons and hasn't been addressed, it simply isn't realistic and to say it happens in 2 out of every 3 games I play really wouldn't be an exaggeration. I accept it may happen from time to time but it is happening in virtually every game I play.Method of goals being conceded is also dull, repetitive and unrealistic. I would estimate that 90% of the goals I concede are from balls lumped over the top to the striker who scores one on one with the keeper, I have tried lots of different instructions & formations to my defence but to no avail. This may be less frustrating if my strikers didn't miss 90% of their one on ones. But again, wholly unrealistic.Their are other frustrating aspects to the game, particularly 16/17yr old prospects demanding moves to a bigger club before they are even good enough to break into the reserves never mind the first team. Undeterred they also demand promises of first team football in contract negotiations regardless of their talent, they just can't be reasoned with.Media interaction seems to have changed little and the same boring, repetitive, pointless unrealistic questions crop up without an option to say anything even remotely like what you would like to say in response. Of course you can you send your assistant to say all the wrong things if you prefer. Surely this could be more imaginative.I don't want the game to be easy, I want it to be fair. The vast majority of the games I play leave with me with the feeling of having been cheated, it's almost as if the game wants you to lose.The most damning verdict I can give of any game is that is simply isn't fun and sadly this version of football manager not only isn't fun, it's a chore.

In my opinion this is the best iteration of FM I have played. However there are still negatives with it though as with every game.Positives:The new development centre allows for players like me who like using younger players and youth prospects to use there own intake more often.The game is much better (in my opinion) at predicting and producing realistic results whilst also providing upsets such as in my personal Ipswich career gave me an fa cup win over Everton but a league thrashing by a newly relegated Southampton.Negatives:I do think that the way you find and approach free agents could do with an improvement as you should have a level of knowledge about their ability as well as be able to search for them specifically as a separate section instead of a broad transfers section.I also think the way that interviews for prospective jobs need to be altered as on many occasions a chairman will question me about things that haven't happened to me such as media controversy.Overall I really do enjoy this game and I will probably play it for a long time yet. Or at least until the next one comes out.

The past 5 seasons or so of FM has been made unfairly difficult for human players by not allowing our players to score goals despite bossing shots on goal, shots on target stats etc. How many times do my players need to miss free headers and one on ones whereas opponents can score the most outrageous goals from their own half to clinch the game? How many times do I need to hit the woodwork 3 times or more? You go look at Piatek's finishing and penalty attributes but he only scores 5 or less goals a season as a regular starter and missed all 4 of his penalties in regular time until i hooked him off penalty duties forever! It is no use creating the best tactics and get your team to shoot from close range and get plenty of shots at goal when the FM creators want you to miss it. I've missed the last FM cos of this, and i am totally regretting giving this a shot. The 3D match engine is a horror as usual but it is not even the biggest bugbear. I know there aren't a decent alternative out there but come on FM fanboys, please critique this game fairly. It is crap. Period.

Been playing this for 5 or 6 years. I enjoyed the 2019 version enormously, and I'm only in the foothills of coming to grips with the 2020 offering, so everything that follows is provisional. But it looks hugely promising. More things you can work with which gets you even deeper into the game. The ways you can manage the tactical setup of the team are better and the game engine seems to have changed.There seems to have been a step backward, though, in that player AI seems to have failed to get forwards to stay onside again. This was a pain in the backside in previous issues, but was far better in 2019. Seems to have got lost again in the new version, leading to unrealistic numbers of offside calls.Also one disappointment. You can only specify the first ball in set plays - so you have the corner to the near post, but you cannot then specify, for instance, that the man at the near post heads down for an onrushing player.. The management of set plays has been static for some time and I would dearly like it to expand for corners and free kicks and also to offer moves you can set up in open play. Understand it might be technically complicated, but- for me at least - it would open a whole new dimension.

The game has zero sense of realism.  Players are in two on one situations and they spank it wide.... have 40 shots in a game and losing 1-0. Going from a 15 win streak to then not winning a game in 10. Its not possible. Usually love thie FM series but finding it tough.

Tl;Dr 3/10 at best. Get it on sale if you have too. Personally wont be buying future versions of the game until below issues are addressed. This game is basically just a database update on FM19. Sure they added some small, new features like the "development center" and detailed contract negotiations but don't let that layer of gloss fool you. The "bread & butter" aka the match engine and tactical aspects of the game are completely crap.  Also, graphics are still very poor compared to other smaller budget games of the same genre.Some examples:- Fullbacks and wide players won't make obvious passes or crosses in the final third. Half of your highlights will be this.....over and over and over again.....especially infuriating when you're behind. - Your tactical instructions will be completely ignored. Ex: Set an instruction for your center-mid with superb stats for "teamwork" to "shoot less"? Screw that. He'll shoot from odd angles and distances anyways. Icing on the cake is that, more often than not, he'll often even score.- Forwards are even worse. Clear-cut chances that even your grandma wouldn't miss, go begging. This will be the other half of your highlights for most games. - Through balls and passing is still kinda unrealistic and wonky. Most through balls don't...well..go through. While passing is just silly from time to time with players constantly switching the ball to the opposite flanks as if everyone is Paul Scholes or Pirlo. Side criticisms of the game:- $50 dollars and they don't even have critical licenses, kits or logos like for Juve.- Graphics are still very outdated compared to much lower budget games of the same genre.- Weird lag, glitches and bugs can be found from time to time. Ex: blank screen appearing rather than the pitch during 3D matches when using custom skins. - Game feels too script-y. I don't know how to explain this but I just don't "feel" like I am playing the game anymore. Everything feels scripted like there's coded scenarios or animations for every possible input I make tactically. I hope I make sense. Maybe add more scripts so the game at least feels rich and realistic, idk?Overall I definitely won't be purchasing any future versions of the game after being a FM fan for over a decade with thousands of hours of game time.

I spent almost 900 hours in FM 2019 and I think i will beat this number with FM 2020. Yes, it needs some improvements here and there, but nothing major.  Still there is no competitor in genre that can match the complexity and quality of this game.

Due to sub-par Match Engine the game ceased to be as realistic as it used to be. It is incredibly and painfully frustrating to witness:- the strikers missing so many 1-on-1 chances (despite decent attributes)- wingers/wing-backs shooting the ball into the side netting rather than crossing (despite instructions)- players missing more penalties than they score (again despite decent attributes)At least one of the above happens 2-3 times per game. At first, when you are excited with the new features, you ignore it and focus on the good stuff. But when you are 80 hours into the game - honestly there is nothing much you can draw your attention to. To sum up, the game is enjoyable, but is a step back in the series and is totally not worth its price. It is beyond my understanding how did the devs not spot these issues during testing.

Its almost unplayable and feels more like FIFA - scripted, stupid and not reminding of football at all. I had high hopes for this one, but there are only superficial additions which are almost useless or well past due date, while match engine (including 3D) is on almost comical level. Number of missed one on ones goes into hundreds during the season - you will simply stop caring if your player is clean through or in good chance, because he won't finish 9/10 chances. Even players with 20 teamwork are not able to square pass into better position for tap in, everyone is attempting shots from 90 degree angle. Sweeper keepers are watching people round them in small box. UX is horrible, interactions largely same as past 5 years and negotiations simply unengaging, probably unfinished. I long for a days, when Football Manager was so advanced, you could actually set up your team formation for defensive and offensive phase.   Its great thats game sells more units every year, but it has probably more to do with marketing. Like the SI guys, but this title is simply so weak, it really starts to remind me of whole FIFA cycle.

Another year another football manager game. Don't get me wrong it's a good game, but still has it's issues like every FM has (and probably will), this one to me seems a little more perfected but it doesn't stop some down right perplexing things happening during matches. There are a few nice additions this time around, like the development centre so you can focus on youth growth. More staff positions add a realistic feel and give you more options to delegate tasks to. Club vision now allows you to make a five year plan with your board adding to the overall feel of being the manager of a club. Is it better than FM 19, to me yes. Is it a radical change that makes you "feel wow...this is so new..." no it is not. It's a game for long term fans of the series but is a great entry point for new players, it feels very accessible and there are plenty of websites out there to give help with guides and tactics. I find the UI is easy to navigate and easy to find what you're looking for.I'm hoping to see some issues addressed in future patches but that of course remains to be seen. Eg. Youth players demanding ridiculous wages, penalty conversions I have had an issue with though it's been better since the last patch.There are more that many others I am sure have mentioned so I won't bother with a long boring list to read through. Solid 8/10If you go for it I hope you enjoy it too!

GENRE>>>>>>>>>>>MANAGEMENTSquad, staff and club management.GAME-PLAY>>>>>>>>8Good. For gamer's who love to analyse lists,stats and look at lots of info. Should be higher but has some annoying and frustrating elements in the match engine. Like forwards struggling with one-on-ones (!?!?!) and players taking impossible angled shots instead of making an obvious pass. You'll cheer and you'll curse so i guess the end result is good enough.GRAPHICS>>>>>>>>3Bad. So bad that a lot of ppl don't even use the 3-D match engine and still use the older 2-D mode or even the text only mode. Fifa 2000 has better graphics. The vanilla user interface and menu layout is not great and has only changed its colours the last 8 years. Most ppl play with user made UI's.MUSIC&SOUND>>>>5Average. No music. Sound effects are ok, they do the job. But little to no attempt to incorporate more stadium atmosphere or teams chants. POLISH>>>>4Average. This series has a reputation of not making any major changes to the core experience. With every years game basically being a database update. Every edition needs a patch to sort numerous issues out from the launch version. You could for example play FB manager 2012 and not notice to much difference in overall experience. With the most notable changes since then being more depth surrounding injuries(sigh) and some minor interface changes and menus that show things that used to be hidden like team hierarchy, squad dynamics. Which since i can remember has been part of the game, players just lacked visual representation of those aspects.REPLAY VALUE>>>>8.5Good, almost great. Mainly a single player game but multiplayer is possible, as well as steam leader boards. If you are big football fan and really get into this game it could really suck you in and you could find yourself putting hundreds of hours into this. You could play with one team to the year 2100 if you manage not to get fired or you could jump around to different leagues or even manage international teams if you are bored of club football. For me the game gets really interesting when the original "real player" database is fazed out eventually and gets replaced by newly generated players and where scouting becomes one of the most fun parts of the game. OVERALL>>>>>>>>57%Objectively not a good game. The core game is decent enough but the devs havn't given players anything new and substantial for years. The mechanics are questionable, the graphics are plain bad and the sound is average. This game prides itself on its database and simulation but that has been largely unchanged for nearly a decade. The only reason why you would buy the newest FB manager is to get a updated database which doesn't justify the price. No real reason for players of older versions to get this one but if you are football mad, like management games and haven't bought any older FB manager games then it would definitely be worth a try.

Try the demo first to see if it's for you.Been playing since the beta opened and been having a great time, here's some of my key takeaways to help anyone considering buying:Streamlining:The game at this point can essentially play itself with you in charge, I never touched some features in previous versions and never really wanted to. Now you can take charge of exactly as many duties as you want and the game feels so much smoother and more fun and you have the peace of mind knowing every aspect of your club is being used reasonably effectively. Obviously you get best results by reading guides online and implementing it yourself but to save you time and stress this feature is really usefulMan Management:In FM19, regardless of my Discipline stat, players were kicking down my door every 5 minutes to whine about something. I'm happy to report they've reigned this in significantly for FM20, yes you still get issues but they seem to be more grounded in what is actually happening.Feedback:SI have really revamped the amount and quality of feedback you receive so it's now much more clear what you are doing that's working and what you need to change on a variety of frontsIn game:Other criticisms you're seeing are right, you don't score many one-on-ones regardless of quality and pressing seems to lead to high number of bookings, but it's the first version of FM where I'm clearly seeing the tactics I'm selecting actually playing out, YMMV. Seem to score from range a lot more consistently though, so it's swings and roundabouts.It's worth checking out if you're looking for a experience that CAN be less intimidating and slow, but allows veterans to delve into all the minutiae of this very deep management sim.

Not sure why this game has positive reviews . Either people at Si are posting there own reviews or people are blind im not sure . This game should be renamed Crash Football because the Si Forum is littered with people complaining about the game crashing or not loading . This is typical of Si every year the game is released in an unfinished format and then you have to rely on Fixes and updates . Always one before Xmas then one after and if your lucky another one in March and then its on to the next years game . By the time you get to play it its due for a new release . I have counted 10,000 posts in there bug section on there forum at this time and the game has only been out 3 weeks . There is no competition for this franchise and they treat there public with discontent every year . You cant even complain on there forum as you get banned . Poor Match Engine coupled with poor graphics make this laughable but the interface is good before it crashes . Jittery graphics which has plagued this game since 2018 has still not been fixed . Lots of potential in this game is let down by a poor company with budgets and time restraints . Strangely enough FM17 is a far better game . As a score for a review having played Football Manager since FM2008 i would give it a 45 / 100 not the 85s or 90s that the payed reviews from game sites give  . Download the demo and try for yourself though as this is just my thoughts

I do not get it why so many people give a good review. It is basically the same game as last year with mini changes. So it cost 55 euros for a game that has no minor changes to last year. What makes me really want to scream at this year FM are two things besides of the broken match engine:1. not good looking graphics - do you actually have a art director or somebody with a good esthetic feel? The 3d Graphic are not appealing at all. It is as you are playing a game from 2005 or worse. Stadium looking all the same. Even if you do not have the licens just do a bit on an afford to build stadium which maybe looking nearly the same es the originals. The light in 3d mode is off - it is not a very good atmosphere. And the most funny part is the weird looking black dots on the grass to simulate that the usage of the pitch. I really do not get this at all.2. animation of the players are - how do i say it - weird. Player sliding over the pitch or moving strange. They do not behave as they should in a 2019 engine. But overall it is the best football manager right now - it is actually the only one or i would say there is no competition. So maybe this is why it feels as you playing the 2019 version with half assed changes.You have a big publisher on hand and i am not sure why it is like this. It feels like that the match engine got dummer. If you watch the whole game you can see that something feels of. Just read the forums. I guess many people are not happy with it.I just do not want to buy a database every year. I want also good graphics and a good engine. Please get somebody for your team that can make it happen.

it's smoother game than before, faster loads, etc. a little more variation in match engine than fm 19. more depth info and management side. i was skeptical, but it's the best FM yet.cons:- i needed to adjust to the bright/strong colors. i preferred smoother color. since i'll play this game for hundreds if not thousand of hours, smoother colors will definitely appreciated. like "matte" colors.- team selection view by default with team shape minimized and positioned at the bottom left, i find it very annoying when i dragged a player to a certain position and the formation getting blocked by attributes comparison pop-up.- sometimes achievement not show up right away. i got "Total Support" and "Superb Dressing Room Atmosphere" a little while after i actually getting it on the game. maybe it's good that the records not lost. maybe finally i'll get Goal of the Month achievement that has been bugged a few years before.- there are a few bugs here and there, but i expect it will be patched. for example:-- often when i make substitution and tactical tweaks, then i clicked confirm, there was no option to give team talk so then there is no option to confirm changes. it stuck and i have to start over. there are 2 button, confirm and team talk. i always want to give team talk but maybe i clicked wrong (confirm) so this bug appear. but still, fix this, or erase confirm button so it's automatically give team talk.-- when i confirm substitution/s, and before it happens, my player on the pitch got a red card. it gets messy.-- sometime after a game, i can't go into dressing room. just next to inbox, annoying.-- there are more but i forgot, but mostly about match day and team selection. other then that, improvements on managerial, development and training is satisfying.
Are the changes wide and expansive? No, but there are a few new features that are nice to have.
They just update roaster and change interview sentences. No improvements since 2015. No point buying the same â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ all over again.

So I have played over 1600 hours in FM 18 and over 1300 hours in FM 19 and I can say that in the 48 hours I've played FM 20, I've enjoyed it. The development center is a nice upgrade to get a quick snapshot view of promising youth players. The in-game engine seems better (I tend to play with better teams so maybe the difference is more notable there) and players' touches and passes seem to look and feel better.With the good, there is of course the not-so-good.1) Bugs. In the staff tab, when I click on "youth team staff"(u-19 or reserves), sometimes the click does not work. It just sits there. This also happens vice-versa when i am in the u-19 staff menu and i click on "first team staff" and of course again it doesnt work. In game, there is also issues again with inside forwards/wingers just running down line and shooting it straight at the near post. It seems like you need to have 15 vision, passing, teamwork, and the "pass before shoot trait" in order to get your player to actually just simply cross the ball to your open forward. Speaking of forwards, for the last 3 years pure single-striker systems struggle to have a consistent scoring striker. Maybe its just the formations I play (vertical tiki-taka for the most part) but I find it hard sometimes to get my striker to consistently score. 2) Ridiculous training injuries. Why the hell do some of my players randomly get a "Training injury" all the time. Also, one thing I've noticed, if you haven't saved in a while, the game will throw an injury your way. IT HAPPENS ALL THE TIME. I personally dislike injuries very much, but that is my preference.All in all, the game is absolutely worth getting for the FM fans and newcomer. The game does a great job in helping you progress through a campaign and set you up for the future with the new development system. I will be curious to see how they fix some of the bugs and issues in the game but once they do, the game will be perfect.

Is this an improvement on fm19? Yes. Is it worth it at full price? Depends.For me, yes. I play each game for hundreds of hours and make databases and the like. The development centre is a big plus for me, as it focuses on one of the best aspects of the game - developing wonderkids. The quality of life updates all over the shop are brilliant to have as well - you really notice the difference.The thing that makes me positive that it was a good decision is that I could never go back to FM19 now, I really like the new features and playing without them would just feel inferior now. Make of that what you will.As to the match engine, in the beta there certainly were many missed one on ones, and wingers shooting from ridiculous angles. Happily I can see that I do not experience these issues any more than I did in previous iterations of the game now. I wouldn't say the match engine is an improvement but after the updates it certainly isn't a step back anymore.Overall, if you're gonna play this game for over 100 hours, buy it. If not, save your money, or wait for a sale. It's another solid iteration which certainly makes some improvements, but isn't improving any faster than in previous years.

Broken match engine. Strikers cannot score, wingers do not cross, penalties galore. Fullbacks do not cross, inside forwards blast the ball into side netting 4-7 times a game every game. No ground trough balls.. BUutT itS JuST YOuR TaCTiCs BroOOEDIT: As of February update the game is much better. All of the issues above have been resolved for the most part. Here are some additional issues I've noticed: The game tends to favor gegen pressing heavily, good luck sitting deep and trying to defend (although may be my tactics) Wingers and Fullbacks tend to blast the ball in a for a cross off defenders frequently, even though instructed to cross less often and playing narrow system. Annoying amount of offsides being shown on comprehensive highlights, since there is no instruction to tell the players to be more careful why show them over and over to me? Defenders frequently head/kick the ball out for a corner when they could clear it elsewhereThere is a glitch that allows you to sell your player for any sum you want (right click after offer accepted and type in whatever price you wish) Some of the descriptions are not written very clearly in what they do and how they impact the team, may be tough for new players to get into the game. Example, mentality should be rebranded as risk. Match sideline shouts are broken and/or not explained clearly in what they are supposed to do. Basically only demand more, praise (when up a goal), and get creative work, the rest just make my team lose focus for no reason. Despite the issues above I can now recommend the game.

It's fun, I like the visual changes, still addicting as ever. Though, the match engine can be improved, especially 1v1's and full-back decision making in terms of crossing/shooting when at the byline. Overall, I'm enjoying it a lot.

Post Update Edit: Players now pass it into the box more often now when they have an option instead of shooting. Sometimes they do in fact shoot it from a narrow angle , but it's rather seldom. The 1v1s are still treacherous though. No improvement whatsoever.I genuinely mean this when I say it, FM20 has, without a doubt, the worst match engine SI has ever implemented. The most common complaint this game has received so far is that strikers consistently miss 1v1s. Unfortunately this problem is rampant in this game. While this has been a problem in previous FMs, I can comfortably say I have yet to see a striker score from a 1 on 1 situation in my first 12 hours of gameplay. Not. A. Single. One.What's this? My winger received an excellent through ball into the box? Oh that's great, if he strikes the ball he might sco-- why is he running all the way to the end of the pitch? Now the angle is far too narrow to get off a decent shot. Well at least he's in an excellent position to lay it off it in to my striker who's wide ope- oh he shot it at the keeper anyways.You will see this happen every game, multiple times. It will consume your highlight reel. It's completely unrealistic. Drives you mad especially when you're losing because your opponent has had one shot from long range at your keeper, and your keeper is a brain dead nonce who dives over the ball. Overlapping full backs are an absolute nightmare. Even worse than wingers. They get themselves in great crossing positions, but consistently decide to get closer to the keeper, but engage them at a narrow angle. Always. Sometimes they even shoot with their weaker foot.JUST PASS THE â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ BALL MATE.â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ this â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥. I'm going back to FM 13.

Game has stagnated for the past few years. ME is plagued with bugs from release, and the game MAY be playable by the last patch in March. That is if the devs get their act together and pull their finger out and focus their attention to all aspects of the game. ME animations are still sub par and looks like something you would find in Actua Soccer 99. Its not all about the graphics, but the animations make it look much worse. Furthermore, the ME is buggy. Far too many one on ones via long through balls, players hardly cross anymore, the ME just feels linear and is a joke to put simplyPosted numerous bug reports but I am officially done. Nothing gets done and im fed up. The developers are far too apathetic and egotistic and are in another world. The game is no where near good enough; compare the ME too FM12 and FM14. Those were much better IMO. Im not sure what planet the devs are on or what they smoke, but their behaviour and attitude needs plenty of work. The game feels like it was made by a bunch of amateurs, and clearly it has been. Tiny studio with no many resources and it clearly depicts this with the final product. Mr Brock states he wants the ME to become as close as real life as possible. I would love to know what he puts in his tea. Firstly. the match sounds have been the same for over 15 years, and CM01/02 had better sounds. Animations still pathetic, grass still looks crappy and to prove they're a joke, they release SNOW as a new feature, but cant even get it right. Have you seen how sloppy and pathetic it looks. And one of the devs quoted that it is a feature they are working on and it will get better in future versions. Are they having a laugh?? Dont release something that looks like a grade one student just drew. It literally looks like a couple white blobs my niece jotted on a piece of paper. Disgusting and just shows the state of the game and the ME at present. Pitch marks look like black dots and are pixelated and reminds me of Doom from the mid 90s.Overall very very disappointed with the lack of progress, especially with the ME, which is their bread and butter. AI squad building still very very bad, and its relatively easy to build a champion team with pretty much any side, because the AI pulls of spastic moves and is nowhere near good enough to build a good squad. AI needs to loan much better players (lower leagues) and just improve drastically. I am not a member of their forums as I have been told that whatever you post, the moderators over there are quick to pounce on negativity which is surprising as I thought they were super helpful and bug reporting would assist in improving the game, but apparently SI have swept so many issues and bugs from previous versions and have yet to rectify them, and just provide a band aid fix. Example? Players hardly ever cross, where as in the previous 2-3 versions, you may as well have called it Crossing and Microsoft Excel simulator. That is how it felt. I highly suggest you hold off buying the game, or at least try out the demo and find out for yourself.Too late for me to get a refund, but will definitely not buy the game for the next 3-4 years as they simply dish out the same garbage every year,. and the game is not playable up until March at the very least, and that is IF they fix the issuesFM19 was a joke as strikers were pretty much useless in the game, and guess what? SI never fixed the issues at all, so the game was pretty much broken for its entire life span. How useless is that. If you are a casual FM player and dont pay attention to these issues and dont care, sure, buy the game. But if you have purchased the last 12 games, and are a hardcore player who wants realism and immersion, do not buy the game right now. It will give you PTSD and anxiety from all the bugs and hair pulling. Potentially great game designed by a small obscure studio with poor facilities without undersoil heating and poor research facilities. EDIT: Here in May, and ME is broken. Small bug like the net bulging when the ball hits it was listed as a bug in January, and was never fixed. Devs are apathetic towards the game. DO NOT BUY  a game where the devs dont even care put their heart in it.

I had not really played any FM since 2016, as the games seems to lose their way. But FM20 really has addressed many of the biggest issues from previous versions. Proabably my favourite improvement is the game engine, where balls curve now and goals (esp FKs) are so much more realistic, as are crosses. No more ridiculous early yellow cards, players can actually play two games in 7 days without being completely tired out. In my first season didn't come across any crazy scheduling issues, although I was knocked out both cups early and was not in Europe...so let's see. It's great the way you can easily delegate tasks to staff and management, depending on how busy you are with other things. So far it is the best of the modern FM games and I highly recommend it.MAJOR EDIT: Wow, now I've seen the posts from other players and realise this game is essentially broken. I'm into my 5th season with Everton, my vision was to be "best of the rest" and my goal was to qualify for champions league. I'm sitting in 4th with a few games to go, by far my best season....and I'm being told I failed my goals....by squad and owner. Owner BTW who is considering selling the club EVERY transfer window so I have a transfer embargo during critical times and miss out on sales or have selling deals messed up. PS I am in the semi final of Europa League when my goal was QF, not taken into account. Instead of being praised for a brilliant job (that the press is telling me I am having) instead am getting told off and having to beg to keep my job. What a load of **** sort if out. AND this stupid game is free now, what a waste of money. Never buying another version of this game.

The match engine is not good. The referees and their obsession for yellow cards and penalties, the 1v1s, your inside forwards and wingers shooting from impossible angles, your players missing from 4 yards out constantly.... This is just a selection of the annoying nonsense in FM20's match engine. I cannot believe how significantly it has regressed from FM19. Until it is improved, I cannot recommend this game even though I'll probably continue playing cause I'm just a sucker for pain and frustration.EDIT: Think It's time to change the review and recommend the game because after all the updates, my experience of the match engine is at least on par with FM19, if not better. I have hope now that my players could score a 1v1, wingers shooting from impossible angles has been fixed, 4 yard misses happen but not that frequently and the refs are not as obsessed with setting yellow card given records every game.

UPDATE: New BETA match engine, same old guff.Now your full backs have lost the gift of sight, as they literally watch crosses, passes and players go past them without actually moving or even sticking a leg out.Anticipation is 0. Literally 0. The ball will bounce off a post and NOBODY will move for it. Everybody, opposition included, now seem to ball watch.Tactics still have no effect. Disciplined, positive, short passing football- so where does my advanced forward pass it? BACK TO THE CENTRE BACK! Who is marked. Who then falls over his own feet for no reason (maybe how the ME represents balance?)Direct wing play? Game goes full back to winger, to full back, to winger- then out for a throw. F***ING CROSS IT YOU PLEBS!I dream of a match that even remotely represents life. Where my defenders move with urgency, where COMMON SENSE exists and passes aren't completely idiotic. Oh well, maybe next year (I won't be buying it).The game engine was broken on release:*Strikers that can't score from inside the 6 yard box*Wing backs who don't/won't CROSS or CUT BACK*Idiot goalkeepers who use their knees instead of their hands*Defenders who turn like a pint of milk and run the ball out of play/into their own net instead of turning sharply with urgency*Players turning onto their weak foot and misplacing passes instead of their good foot- not even under pressure.*EVERY. SINGLE. LONGSHOT. FROM 25 YARDS. FROM A PLAYER WITH 5 FINISHING. AND 5 TECHNIQUE. IN THE LOWEST LEAGUE. WILL SLAM INTO THE TOP CORNER. EVERY TIME. But a half volley from 6 yards central to the goal? Wide mate.It's just not fun, not realistic, not a fair representation of professional players. YET if you ask an SI developer on Twitter, they defend it to the death. I've had a player miss NINE clear cut chances in one game, with 13 finishing, in the National League.I've had a defender pick up the ball on his own 6 yard line, run behind the goalie and try to clear the ball, kicking it off the goalie and INTO HIS OWN NET. What's the tactical instruction for that one then? COMMON SENSE AND EYES?Sort it out SI, your game's a joke.

Nice new features like the development center, club philosophy etc, together with improvements in general to the game. All these things should improve the already impressive replayability of FM.HOWEVER, the match engine has disappointed me again. It has similar flaws the FM19 match engine had: strikers are nearly useless, no overlapping runs from central midfield, no through balls attempted, to name a few. Even worse, wingplay has become a joke with wingers and full backs blasting shots at goal from impossible angels. All this after a lot of feedback SI got from the community during FM19 and the FM20 beta.I hope they can improve the match engine. Until then, this game gets a low score from me and I'll stick to the older FM18.Update 25 February 2020:SI has released a big patch earlier this month, also including the transfer updates up until that date. The match engine was changed as well, but this update didn't improve the experience significantly enough to change my initial review of this game.For future games, I suggest to wait to buy the game until after the winter update as you can then ask for a refund if the game doesn't fulfil your expectations. Now it's impossible to do that because you only get to see the final version of the game 4 months after the initial release.Update 8 April 2020:SI have confirmed on the SI community forum they won't release a new update for this game. As such, my negative recommendation will not change.

So there are some good new features this year BUT... that doesn't matter really because the game is broken.The match engine is dire this year. DIRE.  Frame rate loss and stuttering are terrible problems, and the actions of the players are just ridiculous. Players dribble for 50 yards down the pitch on a regular basis without any attempt from another player to challenge them.  You don't really feel like your decisions and tactical tweaks make much of a difference to the action either. Additionally the text bar commentary is STILL semi disconnected to what you actually see happening on the pitch.  Example :  The text will say something like " Wow, that assist was just delightful!!"  when it was a boring and totally normal short pass that a 12 year old could make.A LOT of work and patching needs to be done to make this game worth buying.  Most of it centres around the poor match day simulation. Wait till they at least try and fix it..... and don't buy for now.

A lot more information displayed. Grades for fan reactions AND board assessments. Graphics are improved but still need some fine tuning. Takes a slightly higher learning curve, but the online manual helps out... Don't even need to buy the game to read the manual just google it. Definitely an improvement above 19 in terms of providing more input, knowledge and understanding of managing a team. Recommend you start a game with a lower league team to get the feel of it on training wheels without the needing to manage blockbuster players and numerous staff. Seems like paychecks are a little larger ;)  . I have seen a few complaints before purchasing and seen where SI quickly issued a patch so the response seems good.  Hopefully you enjoy it as i have so far.

Edited: I can now play, however I can't recommend the product based solely on this DRM issue. Legitimate customers should never encounter DRM that tells them to go away for 24 hours.Original review:Bought game, played beta, locked out by aggressive DRM on launch day and can't play. I can't recommend anything with DRM that prevents any legitimate customers from playing.

GG

This could be the best FM if the match engine will be fixed. Until then this is mediocre.Update: 08.03.2020I waited till the last update. Match Engine kills this game. That's it. You can spend hours with building your roster then coming up with a balanced tactic or whatever. But the match engine is so boring and lightyears from real football that it is too much for me. My centre backs score 10-15 goals from corners and indirect free kicks in one season. My CMs score 7-10 goals / player from outside of the box. In exchange my strikers and inside forwards are retarded in clear cut chances. This is not football.Update: 20.12.2019I changed the recommendation to NOT RECOMMENDED. Match engine is still not fixed which is a big problem because it is so unrealistic that I quit playing this game. I am very sad because everything is at least good in the game but the match engine (the main dish) simulates a sport which is clearly not football. 1 on 1 situations (striker against goalkeeper) almost always missed. It's like in a basketball game Lebron James would miss every second dunk... :(Update: 22.11.2019Since the last update the match engine favors the AI heavily and it is more broken than before. What I did not experience before:- 4 out 4 penalties were missed by my pen. taker (fin, pen tak. 16 rating)- My team shoots 20-30 times on goal (appr. 5-8 long shots) and create 2-5 clear cut chances, meanwhile the AI shoots max 10 per game but scores with 30% (deflected long shots, free kicks, cannon shots from anywhere by Average Joe) . And I have a defensive tactic. I couldn't win 10 games in a row... before the last update I was on a "run" (I am with Real Valladolid in 3rd season and in Europe League, so the "run" is relative definition in this case).- and in 2 weeks 6 major injuries in the squad...- I am literally sad that something messed up/made the match engine worse.What I really don't get is that how can you publish a football simulation which is appr. 20 years old in development and when you start a match and the strikers never score on 1on1s, I can't believe that the developers/testers cannot saw it. I assume SI employees are aware about that strikers tend to score when they are on 1 on 1 against the keeper and not bothered at all by any defender... please someone explain this to me.See ya after the "real version" is published! I am done with beta testing for my money.Update: 20.11.2019compared to fm19 and in just in general:- less major injuries (more than 3 weeks long), more minor injuries (less than a week), more realistic I think- match engine is better than fm19 but needs some refining, e.g.:- 1 on 1 finishing is a joke right now- long shots overpowered (players with a long shot attr. of 14 are Roberto Carlos Academy graduates)- wingers/fbs smashing into the sidenet from zero angle instead of crossing- majestic solos (playing for me Castrovili is Kaka at his best, the AI tends to have a Messi every second match)The problem is that you can create a team and tactic based on the long shot "feature" and you can kill every team. (possesion game + long shot from anywhere) And it's unreal and boring.Don't forget to create custom defensive set pieces instructions, AI tends to expose the default settings.So every part of the game is excellent (can be some bugs of course) except the match engine. Now I would put an "untested/not tested enough" label on the match engine. What I fear is that the 1on1 and the smash into the sidenet things won't be fixed because then every match could be 7-4. The defenders still act time to time like low IQ cows. (they turn around and start running only when the ball is behind them)
IMMERSIVE

They've completely sucked the enjoyment out of playing the game!Where do I start?First of all I was loving the original Beta I took Leeds in the 1st season up as champions, finished 14th EPL in the 2nd and in the 3rd season my crowning glory 4th and a cup final.I thoroughly enjoyed meeting the fans and boards objectives scouting the world to find the best bargain next world class stars, picking up wonderkids and developing the quality players that were already there. Loved the attacking football and watching my goal machines do their thing,Where did it go wrong you ask?As soon as SI started fiddling around and patching things! Now granted the game was released with a lot of cosmetic bugs things like not being able to delete notes and fine players etc however game play was fantastic I would count myself as the majority who just want to sign scout and train players and get on with things and do well with the odd challenge and let things develop season on season as better players come in,However now that they have patched the game it has become so bloody boring, my team which is full of world class players and stars in the making now barely beat the weak teams by a goal and are losing and drawing against teams they should annihilate even lost 4-1 when I was drawing 1-1 after THEY got a player sent off. Also had several games where there have been 7 bookings in a game and sending's off between both teams and I am not even set to 'get stuck in'Anyhow the tactical familarity of my team is great the morale is great squad is incredibly talented I have 3 different tactics to choose from some tweaked and newer than others because as we all know the AI learns your tactics after 8/10 games.I am someone who has been playing these games probably for the best part of 25 years so i know my stuff but because of poor decisions on SI's part the game play and match engine is both boring and unresponsive.I was hoping the full release would remedy this but it is clearly an issue they have given no thought to at all.I just wish I had not spent Â£35 quid and put so much time into this already because as it stands I will now wait until Xmas before I play the game again in vain hope that they update the match engine and game play in a further patch. If you feel they same way then let your voices be heard!

As of the release date (today), the game is in need of several updates to fix the bugs, stuttering, errors, crashing etc. That a game is allowed to be released before it is a finished product and have people purchase it for real hard earned money is criminal. The game runs and the core elements work, though several things do not. Those several things are what makes a person upgrade from the previous iteration. People pay for the new instalment under the impression that it will be better than the previous...an improvement. Unfortunately, as of the release date which happens to be today, the game have several things yet to be fixed which sadly ruin the immersion of the gaming experience. Every time I face one of these bugs, I understandably become frustrated and lose interest. I understand that the bugs will be ironed out over the coming weeks, though until then I cannot recommend 2020 over 2019.UPDATE: Updates have improved the game and its stability, though several features have gone overlooked despite several mentions within the game forum. Features that were highlighted during the release of the game remain broken and neglected. For a game that is released every year with few major upgrades, it is surprising that so many bugs should exist.

So after some time and some updates, some insight and experience, i have decided to rewrite my review.So the game as it are are still bugged, they did sort some of the more paramount things out and iam both a fan and not a fan of their match engine at the same time, i can see a lot of good things in it, but also some annoying bugs, i have more faith now than at last review, that those bugs will be sorted out.iam currently really enjoying my game, specially after i found out how to counter to poor goal conversion rate with tactic and traits(not using exploit tactics) just took me some time to really build a decent tactic tailored for my players, the thing i hated most was poor 1vs1, its still poor but you can counter this with some traits on your attackers. also the fact that my wingers kept shooting into the side of the net instead of trying to pass it, sorted that out too with shoot less + the trait "looking to pass rather than score"ofc this takes time to train, unlesss your using editor, i do prefer the normal way myself, even tho i own the editor. they fixed the stats bug that rendered most of the regens useless, so now one can enjoy newly created wonderkids again. so with this in mind i decided to change my negative review, to a positive.my old review is readable below this new one.Old Review: "this game have been one of my favorite games for almost 10 years, and i can say that if this is the way they expect to continue, i am done. the match engine is a mess and there are a lot of weird stuff happening in matches, some matches seems to be predetermined, so no matter how many times you reload and change tactics and players you cant get a different result, new regens are generated without all their stats set, so all their undefined stats end up as a 1, which makes them useless, so long games arent a posiblilty at the moment, there are a lot of fixing before i would recommend anyone to use money on this game, so save your self some headache and stick with the 2019 version until they have fixed this game, who have to potential to be the best FM ever, but at the moment are unplayable unless your someone who edits everything."

I have been a hard-core fan of FM since FM 2015. The game just keeps going from strength to strength every year. And this year, it got even better! It also helps that this really feeds into my OCD and the management aspect of football is lacking in the other 2 major football games (FIFA and PES). I was playing the Demo for most part of the year (too expensive) before buying the full version recently (on sale). Short summary:Pros:Very deep and informative systemAll inclusive in terms of various aspects of the sportRefined Match Engine (compared to previous titles)Scores of options to start your journey (I always start out unemployed)Widest collection of clubs and countries and national teamsA huge community online to keep engagementConsLack of licenses (easily fixable with mods)Sometimes different features of the games can be too difficult to understandAlmost too in-depth sometimes to have fun playing (I haven't experienced this but many people I know have)The game can be brutally unforgiving at timesAnd that's my short review! I might edit in the future if I feel something should be added/removed. Have fun managing!

UPDATE--played another 84 hours. I feel like this game is much more scripted than past games. I played as Arsenal and am 2nd in the EPL now. FA Cup comes around, and I have tried, I kid you not, 11 times to beat a League 2 team. Every single time, a different player gets a red card and I lose by at least one goal. I still lose even if I try to take a vacation and sim. This is about par for the course too. I've had Lewandowski line up next to Laca, and watch him receive a pass two meters in from the penalty spot, but hit the shot so poorly that it goes out for a THROW IN. That's nearly impossible. I convert 1 on 1 opportunities at maybe a 10-15% rate, and I had 37 shots on target against Ipswich Town but lost 2-1 because their keeper had over 30 saves. Something is really broken in the mechanics around shooting (and making the easy pass on a 2 on 1 instead of shooting it into the side netting) that makes the games within the game unplayable until fixed.--------------------------------------------------------------------I rarely leave reviews, but I feel like it's important to for this game. I've played these games since Championship Manager 2004 I believe, so I've spent thousands of hours (yikes) not just on Steam.First of all, the match engine is broken. Shattered. Useless.I've had more games than I can count with over 25 shots on target and haven't scored a goal, I've tried every tactic in the world to try to get touches to my Trequartista but can't get the ball to him, I score the majority of my goals from outside of the box even tho I almost always use "Work Ball into the Box" (I try to mainly play an Arsenal Tiki Taka), but most frustratingly of all are 1v1s.1v1s are pointless. I've scored exactly one in more than a whole season of play, regardless if the finishing is 12 or 19--mind you, a lot of these goalies were **** from Sky Bet Championship in cup play too. I've yet to see them make an extra pass inside the box to score a goalie (again, think Arsenal) even when I've had a 4 to 1 break (he shot it from outside the box). It's unbelievable how hard it is to score a normal close goal. Want to win? Figure out a solid defensive structure, counter, and fire away from 30m because you're better off with that than 2 forwards and an AMC against a goalie. The UI is solid and the visuals are fine, nothing too exciting, but the board is ruthless. I signed Vignato who scored 18 goals and 15 assists in his first season, and was considered a decent price, but I still got a B on the signing. No explanation why. In all honesty, if I hadn't pre-ordered, I would ask for my money back on this game and wait until next year. I'd just get an updated roster for FM 2017, which I think has the most balanced match engine of all the recent games, because I want to try to emulate football management, and this game resembles very little the game I love.
It's hard to deliver enjoyable experience once, but it's almost impossible to do that on yearly basis. Thanks dev team!

Let me start by saying I own FM 11, 12, 13, 14, 16, 17, 18, and 20 and have 2,517 hours played across all of those versions. This could easily be a thumbs up because I love the FM series as a whole...but DAMN this is literally the same exact game from when I started playing (FM11). Unfortunately this series has fallen into the same yearly update cycle that FIFA has -- making slight modifications/tweaks to the engine + updated roster and selling it as a whole new game at full price. At the end of the day, though, it's still FM and it's still super addicting which has me coming back year after year.

Laaaaadies and gentlemen, welcome to the greatest game there ever was!  Spacebar Smashing Press Conference Simulator!  Once again you can feel the joy of blisters forming on your fingers as you smash that space bar to prompt the game forward as it constantly stops for no real reason multiple times per in game day!  And take your joy to a whole new level in the press conferences as we bring you THE EXACT SAME questions from years gone by, but with the bonus of new questions that make no sense!  Experience the joy of answering the same questions each and every in game week in multiple weekly press conferences.  And don't worry, you still have to do them because your assistant manager will just upset your players if you leave it to him!  Speaking of upset players, they're still here, still moaning, still wanting new contracts in the first year of new contracts and still getting upset about anything and everything just because!  And speaking of inept staff, your chief scout wont even assign someone to watch the next opposition even if he's highly rated and experienced!I've put a lot of time in to this year and last year.  The core is somewhere buried amongst all the utter tosh the devs throw in every year, but it's getting harder and harder to enjoy.  SI Games seems to have forgotten that people play games to escape the tedium of life and work, not to experience someone else's.  Having multiple press conferences every week with the same quesitons over and over and over and over and over and over is utterly soul destroying, having players whinge constantly is just annoying and does anyone know the point of the judging skills with scouts because the highly skilled and low skilled seem to rate guys the same.I'll play this, I'll enjoy team building, tactics, transfers and developing young players, but all of that will be severely tarnished by all the add on crap that doesn't need to be there.  And the worst of it is, with the press conferences, this wouldn't be so bad if it was just 2-3 questions once a week.  I wish someone at SI would ask "does it make it more fun" once in a while.

Although there are many new features aimed to improve your gaming experience, match simulation, the core feature of this game is still broken:1. Home advantage is ridiculous, when you are playing as the away team, you can never score even if you have more than 15 shots and over half of them are on target. On the other hand, the home team scored as soon as they have 1 or 2 shots on target.2. Players are still doing insane and unreasonable actions, e.g. clearing the ball to my own end line when they got the ball near mid-field. This issue persisted for at least 5 years in this franchise.3. Players always use header to knock the ball to opponent players even if there is absolutely no threat around him.4. You can hardly score from 1 on 1 chances, this is very unrealistic, and persisted many years as well.I recommend against buying Football Manager 2020 at least at this stage unless match simulation has significant improvements.

The game engine seems far from finished. Football matches seem rather unrealistic if you just look at the teams moving the ball around.* Players tend to play the ball back to the goalkeeper, even if they are situated on the opposing half.* Players tend to cross the ball from the side into their own box (even had an opposing player heading the ball into my goal).* Long balls are played much too often and cover very long distances, resulting in a lot of 1vs1 situations in front of the goal (in which the player on the ball never scores).* There are an absurd amount of attacks that turn out to be offside.I would have rather looked at a functioning 2D pitch than this 3D pitch with 'improved' animations. It really doesn't feel like a game of football anymore...

Imagine taking your car into a garage for a full service and MOT and all they did was swap your tires around and stick a new smelly dangly thing on your rearview mirror. That's the Football Manager franchise.Again, this is another 'evolutionary' update with even less in it than usual. You have a data update for the new season, and a few things moved around (player development mostly). The player portraits still look like a police photo-fit of someone they'd like to help them with their enquiries, the match engine is slightly less crap, and the game runs a couple of percent faster with a full database of players.And that's it... really.Not worth the release price at all, fair price would be at least half for what is a glorified patch with a data update.

Heres the reality of what I had seen so far on the game and this beta release:The match engine so far is a ABSOLUTE DISGRACE.The main thing about it is players don't adhere to certain tactical instructions at all. They simply don't adhere to instructions like : pass it shorter , shoot less often etc. Players love launching the ball for absolutely no reasons. Centerbacks launch the ball forward to a striker. Play constantly "switches" to other flanks about 3495895 times a game. Players loose possesion for no reason without even any pressure on them. Players miss 1v1 chances that are easier to score than miss on a CONSISTENT basis and dont get me wrong when i tested on my test juve save i won league 102 pts and all cups and cl semi  but i had seen this from TOP strikers like higuain etc miss TIME AND TIME AGAIN 1v1 chances however what DOES go in is : long shots , indirect free kicks , free kicks from rediculous ranges etc. The football being played is just rediculous. Often times players can't string a pass when they have obvious passing options they still launch a ball even with individual instructions such as shorter passing ( and i tested with good players.) NOW AS FAR AS GAME IN GENERAL AND NEW FEATURES:The most notable feature in the game is that the board intervenes now when u dont follow certian philosophies such as sing players under 23 for first team etc. They might cancel future transfers u make because u didnt sign or adhere to these philosophies.Theres also now a "code of conduct" that automatically disciplines players for various offenses such as missed training , red card etc.And thats about all I saw so far new.The game is roughly the same as last year except now the match engine in the beta at least is piss poor and needs RADICAL changes for the game to be worth playing.HERES A UPDATE:WHEN THE â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ PATCH 20.2 CAME OUT IT ABSOLUTELY PUT A NAIL IN THE COFFIN OF THIS â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ MATCH ENGINE. Well, it's a good old (sometimes bad) Football Manager. Not many changes since last year. Still no multi-monitor support, no female football, no possibility to create sandbox leagues, etc (the full list is very long actually). New skin (I fiercely dislike new buttons), updated rosters (and no more Juventus license - have fun eliminating "Zebre" from random game files), some nice, but still minor, improvements. And, of course, REALLY A LOT of woodwork (if you missed couple  FMs, they even hid woodwork from stats).If you already played FM before, you'll most likely buy it again 'cause there is no competition at all. If not, it's worth trying. With a few clicks, you can control your team better than in scripted simulators like FIFA or PES. There are no major match engine issues this year so the beta is quite playable. Therefore, I recommend it without a doubt and without waiting for a release.

The Good - Much better Game EngineMore interesting Dialogue options and some added media stuff.Adding seasonal goals has increased the depth and functionality of transfers and signing staff. Players also seem to value these items more than in the past.Same game fundamentally that I know and love.The Bad -I've seen 99.9% of all one on ones go out of bounds or miss. Mine and NPC combined. 50+ Hours played. literally have seen 100s of 1on1 breakaways.My players also seem to ignore "Shoot Less" and "Work Ball Into Box" and shoot from 30-40 yards out with both instructions.For some reason the dialogue options are confused. I'm in first playing second place - Dialogue option "The standings currently have us in 4th and our opponents in 1st..."Also not sure how I am expected to finish in the bottom half of the league. I'm undefeated as of January in the Serie C/C in 1st place with a 6 point lead. If I lost literally every game I have left I'd still finish comfortably in 12th. This affects everything from dialogue options, future player signings and betting odds. This is an ongoing problem that needs to be fixed.

I've owned every Football Manager for nearly a decade. I skipped FM 19 here on Steam but bought FM 19 Touch on the Nintendo Switch.FM 2020 is more of the same with some solid improvements. Certainly compared to 18, the quick tactic creator can be great for newer players who don't quite know what every tactic option does. Pick a template (with helpful in-game descriptions on what exactly the tactics do), tweak it a bit for how your team plays, and you're good to go. The more detail training schedules help out too to really focus your team's weaknessses, rather than forcing you into broad attacking/defense/technical categories.I really think FM 20 is the best starter entry into the series in a long time. Doesn't mean you're guaranteed success or a championship, especially if you start on a top-league team with no experience. But it walks you through the basics of setting up your team even if you don't bother delegating tasks to your coaching staff, and even if you lose, you'll at least have some idea WHY you're losing.Overall an excellent addition to the franchise.

TL:DR - Solid release with lots of small and large improvements, however some of the same issues still present.For me this is probably the strongest release in a long time so far. Engine feels slightly improved from last year with only a couple of bugs noticed and some of the common ones from the previous releases fixed.PROSAs well as that they have once again added a new large feature in the player development system, I am yet to get stuck into it however it looks a decent addition with some nice tools for developing your youth teams. They have definitely expanded in this area.As well as the major additions they have refined and sharpened a lot of existing content and features. I really enjoy the expanded staff responsibilities. Allows you to make a lot more use out of your backroom team, I have hired a really strong Head of Youth development in my game and given him permission to find and sign new players for the U18s, however I have kept responsibility for the final say meaning if the players not good enough or in a position thats already saturated I can veto it.There are very minor improvements that only experienced players will likely even notice and even I am finding hard to recall. One example I can say is that when you get promoted from lower leagues in previous game you always go into the next season 500-1 or even 1000-1 to win the league, regardless of signings or how good your team is.This is the first time where the odds actually reflected reality when I went up. My players were really strong and I made big loan signings. We started the season at 16-1 to go up. It felt more realistic.Another example of these minor improvements and refinements was when negotiating deals. In previous titles I found the player demands pre contract were virtually useless. You could just remove them all and the player would still be happy to negotiate, he might just ask for a little more money.Not any more, players will reject negotiations more often if you remove all there demands.There are lots of tweaks and changes like this and they add up to a more immersive and enjoyable game with more problems to solve and elements to manage and balance. May add more of the better ones when I encounter them in my game and am reminded.The overall UI is an improvement for me also, feels clearer and more concise. Easier to navigate.CONSSome of the small main issues and in my opinion the one big problem with FM still exist.Small issues like team shouts being too repetitive and not really dynamic, unrealistic player fallout when a â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ 4th choice defender is unhappy he isn't starting, teams worse then yours offering you a job every week when your doing well etc. A lot of these still haven't been addressed, though some of them have as I pointed to in my previous section. These didn't make the game unplayable then and don't know.The main issue is still there for me. Once you have mastered the game its too easy and always will be. For experienced players who understand the games tactical and man management systems it becomes far too easy. I am able to take a conference team to the premiership in 5-7 seasons every single game I start without fail. The tactics I play haven't changed since FM2016 really, they were tweaked in the last tactical overhaul but the principle is still the same.I just follow the same tried and tested formula. Its always the same and there isn't really that big a challenge anymore.The game is still fun for me and I enjoy growing my team, discovering new talent, taking my team from the lowest league to the best team in the world and doing big money negotiations etc.But as well as new features and expansions on what is there I long for a new challenge in the games existing mechanics. Maybe a harder mode with some new problems to deal with, or where the existing problems are tougher to deal with or identify. The last few releases have added a lot of identification and prevention tools, I think this was largely down to the community complaining about the game being broken in regards to the match engine, injuries and tactics etc.SI do listen to the fan base and gave a lot of ways to make identification of these complaints easier, as virtually 99% of the time it was the player not managing properly, not an issue with the game.I fear SI will never be able to please everyone in this regard and they have settled on a balance between the two types of players.What we have here is the best football management game there has ever been or will be, every year improvements are made and this year is no different. This may even be the greatest Tycoon / simulation game ever made. 10/10 everytime.

As of this title I've played every Football Manager game since 2012 on Steam.While I'll recommend this game, from what I've seen so far it's a small visual update to the previous years game with a greater emphasis to changes to the in game systems and mechanics surrounding the management of your club. I've come across some errors with the in game 3D engine not always matching up with the calls being made (i.e. constant offside calls when in the 3D match engine its clearly onside) but that is probably a beta issue. The 3D engine doesn't appear to be greatly improved graphically, but I've noticed more nuanced movement and animations with the players on the pitch. Player management, particularly squad management has changed somewhat and there are even more ways to classify your players and set training now.You may view this as being more of the same but in my experience that's not always a bad thing with Football Manager.
