This game can be incredibly frustrating and I do not believe that it warrants the full $50 price tag.  Don't get me wrong, as I have had enjoyable moments in the game, but those come less and less the longer I play.First and most importantly, the ME is in need of work.  -Strikers are often on the losing ends of 1v1s way too many times.  I don't know if this done to create some difficulty in the game, but it seems almost impossible to score off these chances.  -Long shots are still a bit too prevalent in this game.-Wingers and fullbacks do not cut back properly when striker is unmarked in box.-Defenders seem to lack any sense of positioning when dealing with set-pieces.  -Players do some weird animation when trying to prevent the ball from going out of bounds.  They manage to save it but then take a number of steps beyond the ball, allowing the opposition to gain possession.-VAR is way too consistent in its decisions.  (ie if called in the box, it will always be a penalty.  If the referee goes to check for offsides, it will always be offside)-Also, VAR sometime call an onside goal, offside (https://community.sigames.com/topic/520454-var-offside-issues/) - Also note that SI will not be updating the ME for FM2020 (https://community.sigames.com/topic/518591-thanks-for-all-the-feedback/) As a result, some of these known bugs/issues will not be resolved (which makes it somewhat a slap in the face that SI still is considering charging full price)Second, AI transfers make no sense-This is more of a gripe than a bug.  Players seem to make moves to other clubs that are either A) questionable or B) the teams would never sell normally.  You are telling me that Liverpool would willingly sell VVD to Paris for Â£60 million?  After a Champions League winning season in which he was a key player for the team?

I moved Celtic and Rangers into the Vanarama so I can build something.  I've done this in multiple incarnations of this game, so I know to change nation to England, but somehow we are still in the Scottish League Cup (and group stage at that) which has added extra games.  Not a problem as it gave me a chance to field mainly promising U23s against lower league sides.Including friendlies (four I think), I've played 22 games.  I've won 19, with the only defeat being away in the CL playoff, which I won anyway. One draw was in the League Cup group and another was away in a CL qualifier.  We've played one CL group match away to Galatasaray, and came from 2-0 down to win 3-2 and top a group with PSG.Because of the extra matches from the league cup and Europe, we've only played five league matches, which have all been won with a goal difference of 21-1.  We are sitting 8th (only seven points behind) having played five games less than everyone else, and suddenly half my squad have lost faith in me because we are apparently struggling.  It's mainly key players as well who have all had a lot of game time.Perhaps the game is great if you don't edit anything, but you'd think after 20 years of providing an editor, they'd have made the game engine smart enough to deal with odd situations that arise from using it.I attempt to warn the main instigator about his conduct and he says he always conducts himself well on the pitch.  He has no idea the angry meeting has even taken place.Add to that there seems to still be an awful lot of random injuries out of nowhere.  This lot don't seem to be getting any better at anything other than the 3D pitch.  Mind you, my wide players don't seem to be able to take anyone on.  They sprint to the last third, then slowly walk, then get tackled by a guy already lying on the ground.  That guy will then get up and get the ball whilst my guy stands around wondering where he is.Corners don't go anywhere other than into the six yard box to be immediately cleared by a centre half.  Also, the camera angle for corners is horrific.  You can't tell whats happening.So now I have Aberdeen at home in the league cup.  I've attended the prematch interview and one of the questions is "Aberdeen won't be used to visiting smaller stadiums like CELTIC PARK". Played nearly 100 hours in two weeks. As someone completely new to FM, this game is absolutely fantastic. Sure there is some weird situations where a 1 on 1 opportunity seems to get blown, but overall the game plays correctly, and tiny changes in your tactics can make or break a big match. Been doing my run thru with Manchester City and after a very successful first season, we struggled behind Liverpool our second year, resulting in a few big transfers and a stronger focus on youth development. Now going into my third year we are boasting a strong winning streak, with Liverpool left in the dust, and our bitter rivals - Manchester United hot on our tails. The game creates a story in itself, the interviews get repetitive but still hold meaning even after the 20th time being asked the same question. Your team reacts to every word, and a slight drop in morale can cost your entire squad their form. Great game, and definitely worth the pick up. I wanted to get the game on sale but go figure I got it a week before it finally went on sale.. but I feel I already gained my moneys worth!
This years edition is slightly better than last years imo. More 2D classic match engines would be great.

I've purchased this game twice so far. The first time directly from Origin. The game had constant errors which I researched fixes to and found some success after changing some settings in the game files. That lasted about a day and then the game wouldn't even launch, so I requested a refund which they graciously provided. About a week later I noticed that this game was available on Steam and figured both Steam and Origin had rights to the game so I re-purchased it through Steam because I trust them more than Origin. Turns out the game is still run through Origin even when you purchase it on Steam. I got a good couple days of non-interrupted game play from the Steam-Origin version until I ran into the same errors as before. Overall this has been a pretty â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ product. I continued to try to play it because I am a big soccer fan and hoped to have some fun playing, but that is basically impossible because Origin and EA are complete â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥. I will likely be requesting a second refund of this game.

Worst fifa I ever played. Worst game I ever played. Defending is nonexistent, midfielders won't ever help defending. I am literally outnumbered by opponent AI in my own box during a positional attack, I won't even say anything about counterattacks. Worst "legendary" difficulty, literally every 60 OVR player becomes Ronaldinho and only does skill moves and holds the ball unnecessary. You score loads of goals, it's not even fun anymore. I remember having to work hard to snap a 1-0 win in Fifa 19 against a legendary AI with a lesser team, now 90% of the games finish after at least 2-3 goals were scored by each side. 71-37 goal difference after 15 games, 4 minutes half, sounds realistic, right? I am a career mode player, always have been and was happy to hear about the new development system and how you can customize your manager, but the visuals are a joke as well. During negotiations, there are always 2 bald guy generic models talking to each other. How is this even possible? It's not completely ruining the gameplay or something, but it's a huge lack of respect towards us as customers. I feel like I bought an unfinished game, a scam. It's the last time I'll ever get a game from this ****hole of a company. Boycotting EA is the only logical solution.

To be honest, this is the first time I've ever owned a paid EA Product after memes and complaints on the Internet, and this FIFA 21 game proved why EA should never suck my blood again. First, why switching focus from the game is considered leaving the match anyway? It does not make sense, as I usually play in 1/4 window mode, what if I misclicked outside of the game window, for example to make a quick message check? Lol that is the most nonsensical thing I have ever experienced and witnessed over years since I started playing games.Second, the game does not promote fair play. Why? Because when stronger team gets their lead, they have the choice to passing the ball around without ANY penalties, for the rest of the game. At least in Fifa Online 4 - a free version of FIFA game which is released for the Asia Market has this kind of penalty, so why is it left out in this game?Third, bugs and bugs everywhere. I have to admit that EA has one of - if not - the worst servers in the world. On average, I have to find match 13 times in order to play a game of FIFA 21, 12 other attempts lead me to a pre-game screen, and if the "Advance" button did not disappear after my 3 Enters, I understood that I should better quit and find a new match. Also, sometimes in the game my players got kicked into the air for NO REASONS.In short, all I would like to say is that EA lacks ethics to ever ask people to spend 80$ in such a poorly-invested and chaotic mess. You would never get my money again and for those who are about to buy this game, just dont.

After playing over 100 hours of this game mostly career mode on ULTIMATE difficulty, I must say I have never been more disappointed in a game. The defence is extremely bad, CDMs (both yours and the AI's) don't help the defenders at all and will stand and watch from outside the box as your defenders get ganged on. They just stroll back for counter attacks. Goal Keepers are spectators and always get beat on the near post. EA focused too much on the attacking aspect of the game and went out of their way to nerf defending. Winning all your games 7 - 3 isn't fun at all for anyone who actually knows the sport. The development plan for players was a welcomed addition but turning all your players to 5* skillers / 5* foot in less than half a season is really dumb. The game wasn't tested and the EA game changers should be ashamed for praising this game. I'm going back to play a modded Fifa 20 instead of playing this trash and that should tell you all you need to know. Definitely DO NOT BUY this game. It might be playable down the road with updates and mods but for now SAVE YOUR MONEY!!!

Buying FIFA is like an abusive relationship, they give you s***t but you keep taking it just because once you had this great times. Yeah, they do somethings here and there but in the end itÂ´s just crap. The new training system in manager mode is as raw as it could be, the game play is the worst theyÂ´ve had in years, IÂ´m playing legendary and scoring 7 goals and up per match, IÂ´d like to see a goalkeeper actually save something, or what about the fact that your defenders will stay still, no matter if the ball is just in front of them, you have to defend one at a time. The market is absurd I bought king (77) for 6M and Eric Garci for 5M o... and these negotiations happenned with two identical avatars, whatÂ´s up with that? I've purchased FIFA since 06. Back in the day they really focused on the quality of gameplay and ehnacing the manager mode aspect of the game with every new version. However, since FIFA 2014, they've virtually done nothing for the game other than minute gameplay changes and completely irrelevant and useless career mode  "upgrades" that virtually no one asked for or wanted. But that's not even the worst part, because we already grew accustomed to being disappointed for the offline modes. They literally still have glitches that were in the game in FIFA 19. The same exact lineup/team squad glitches from two years ago. This shows there is literally 0 f***s given when it comes to improving the game. As long as they license the teams and make bank off FUT, they literally will sell us the exact same game for years to come. Also, EA openly admitted to scripting. They declined to use that term, but they said they added many certain features to make the game 'realistic' so if the AI suddenly puts together and insane amount of precise passes that leads to a goal, there is little to nothing you can do unless you can predict AI movement. This is the same for online, where your players will randomly become lethargic when you're ahead so that the opponent has a shot to make the match more dramatic. EA is just dishonest with us and gives us the middle finger with every entry because they know we are suckers that'll buy every year. Do yourself a favor and don't be an idiot like the rest of us, and skip this game. Maybe then, they'll actually do something to improve the title.

I have been a fan of FIFA since FIFA 99. I have bought the game every couple of years and also the World Cup releases in 2010 and 2014 (wish they would do this again, including it with 18 was okay, but I enjoyed the 'Story of Qualifying' Feature). I used to enjoy FUT when you could play in Solo leagues and Cup Tournaments, but now in 21 it's become hot garbage that is geared only for online play with the anti-social dregs of humanity that play these games online. The main feature in FIFA I play for is the Career Mode, and much as many have mentioned they made some incredible improvements in FIFA 21 and I've just been totaly absorbed by the game and have been playing it for hours upon hours starting several different career saves. The dynamic potential for youth players, and the ability to really take a hand in player development including changing players positions to match your tactics rather than the old way where you had to match your tactics to the players you could get is so much more immersive and fun! As a footnote I'll also say that I am perhaps in the minority when I say I actually enjoyed the Volta mode as well (again, only in single player) more than I thought I would. If you enjoy soccer/football do yourself a favor and buy this game, if you liked Career Mode in past versions, you will love the new additions in 21. FUT has become a full on pile of flaming garbage and a money grab, and now totally alienates solo players.

It brings with it some differences concerning the gameplay which can be considered as improvements. There are also innovations in different game modes. The developers worked hard, limiting to refine mechanics and structures in themselves solid for a game that may at first look the same as the one before it, but that actually offers differences, sensitive but effective, especially in terms of control and dynamism. FIFA 21 is a great game. It is a more complete title than its predecessor, although the graphic component is practically identical. The little refinements make the biggest impressions this year, and Iâ€™m excited to see how the next-generation versions will perform.OVERALL SCORE: 9/10

After years on PES, I grew tired of having to download option files only to have them reset each time Konami released an update. Then have a week or so wait to download the next option file. So, I decided to move over to FIFA for the slick presentation and official licencing knowing full well the on-pitch experience would be somewhat 'diluted'. I was happy to trade a little bit of on-pitch authenticity and excitement for a more rounded gaming experience.I am pleasantly surprised. The gameplay is miles ahead of what I remember from FIFA games. It's fluid, creative and takes a lot of time to master. No longer are you tied to rails with only a few control options. You now have an exhaustive list of controls including agile dribbling, customisable passing and shooting options, different ways to control runs off the ball and much more. The ball still feels a little 'light' and almost floats but nothing game-breaking. It's also a lot more unpredictable than before with lots of collisions, spills and loose balls. The biggest thing for me is that it doesnt feel fake or forced - each game is unique and the replay value is still there many games into career mode. All in all, it's a really competent on-pitch experience that gives PES a run for its money. Then, obviously, you move on to the off-field experience. Having the real music, intros, stadiums, kits etc makes a huge difference to the player. It's incredibly immersive.Finally, the career mode is leagues ahead of Master League on PES. With player happiness, sharpness, training and development there is plenty of man-management going on. Having the ability to manually negotiate contracts and transfers in a fantastic little mini game is also very welcome. You can also sim games and drop-in/drop-out at will which gives a sort of football manager/FIFA hybrid which is excellent for giving players a full career mode experience without having to play every single minute of every single game. Taking control of key fixtures is essential but you are welcome to watch more simple games from a birds eye management view. And if things are going surprisingly badly, just put yourself in the game to try and turn things around. It's an excellent addition.Not the perfect football game but as an overall experience it is very hard to beat. PES still wins on the pitch but that gap has been closed. Off the pitch, FIFA is the superior experience by a long margin.

The gameing market is a absolute p take now sorry to say . many years ago i used to get up take myself into town on a weekend while i had been pondering what to buy with my hard earned cash .after deciding what to get you walked up to the counter empty box in hand as the assistant would take your  empty box and unlock the cupboard where they would reach in bring the cd out with all the other goodies what came with the game, instructions , maps, cards sometimes even a special object connected to the game. this was your personnel game to keep a item you had bought that you could see and hold .the thing is this was the complete finished game no add ons no dlcs no extras this was it the one true gem with bugs and glitches and everything knowing that one day this game would be a classic to sell on in years to come . what do we get today in the digital world ABSOLUTELY NOTHING , yes better graphics , updates to fix bugs and glitches then each year they bring the same game out with little tweaks updated teams and we fork out 50 quid each year for the developers and have nothing in our hands to show for it. that is me finished now with fifa, golf , cricket, racing games etc . i think ill be sticking with my fantasy , strategy games where i feel you get a little bit more for your money even though you still have to keep forking out money for add ons and still have nothing to show for it . the gameing market in this digital age is a complete rip off to the consumer

Absolutely jaw dropping. This game is the epitome of a pathetic cash grab by a monopolizing triple A company. This game has bugs and glitches that have been present for 3+ years. This game is nothing more than FIFA 18 with a few updates equivalent to a DLC. Sad to say I've been a fan of this series since FIFA 10, and I can confidently say there has been very few worthy upgrades to the series in the last decade. There are, in fact, features that were present in that iteration of this game that aren't present in this years edition, or have even been present since. If you're looking for a poorly optimized gambling simulator, then go ahead and sink your money into this pile of hot, sweaty garbage. The developers clearly do not care about this series, EA does not care about the Madden series, they do not care about the 2K series, they do not care about the UFC series, they do not care about their fans.If you don't believe me, look into the lead developer of Madden who claimed having a Meracritic score of 2.0 (the lowest on the sites history) was better than 1. Look into FIFA shamelessly advertising the blatant gambling section of this game in a childrens magazine, listing it as the second step to enjoying this game.This game is a sad joke and, if I hadn't accidentally allowed to game to run while I was away at work for 2 days, I would have gotten my money back.Shame on you, EA.Pros:It's soccer. If you like soccer/football, this is basically the only place to play it.Cons:I could quite literally go on writing a novel listing the cons, but I won't waste my own time.If you have nothing better to spend your money on, why not.

I'll keep this brief. I've been playing FIFA for ~10 years and this one is probably the best one since Frostbite took over. If you are looking to upgrade from any other previous FIFA, I'd say it is a great decision. + Substantial Career Mode Changes and Upgrades+ Improved gameplay+ Improved crossing system + Improved defensive system+ New VOLTA things (New locations,etc) + New FUT Stuff (some improvements)+ Available on Steam for the first time- Lost important licenses (Roma, Serie B, etc)- No real visual improvements since FIFA 20- Still pay-to-win (FUT)Still, I'd totally recommend FIFA 21.

Firstly, the game is amazing, no doubt about that. The graphics are extraordinary, the gameplay mechanics are fantastic. It's a great gaming experience. But the content in the game is not at par with the price. At INR 3999, its one of the costlier games in the market, and it has very little to show for it. Lets start with what it lacks.1. A story. Starting with the Journey I found a newfound interest in sports games thanks to the story mode. In FIFA 21, there is a story mode in the game under VOLTA football- the Debut, but the story is far too short to be that interesting, it keeps us hanging definitely.2. Lack of official stadiums- The game doesnt include a lot of official stadiums including Camp Nou, probably because PES got their rights.3. Weird facial glitches during celebrations- I've been playing at 1920*1080 at ultra and sometimes while celebrating the players facial expressions get twisted into weird angles.It's really good, the graphics are fantastic, the mechanics are extraordinary, but still to my personal opinion it's not worth the buck. If you get it on a sale, grab it.

The minimum expected from an EA game, but it is very poor by any other standards.The gameplay has changed without any change in quality compared to the previous game. EA did realise that there were issues in attacking play, which is good. Their solution of absolutely nullifying any sort of defensive play, not so much. Ultimate team, being the only really competitive game mode enhances the gameplay issues much more than any other one. With less unnatural and overpowered players in seasons the gameplay feels a lot less like rabid dog running around the pitch with chimpanzees trying to defend your goal. But it's still showing there as well. Career mode has had some changes and improvements taking many of the elements of football manager, but the computer AI is way too weak to pose any sort of competition for anyone whose played the game before. With this the actual "playing" element  of career mode has become very boring, not good. Volta, basically, street football was surprisingly decent this year. The different environments, the in game commentary and soundtrack all added a very nice touch and with different available players such as boxing star AJ made the game mode feel very arcadesque, which it is supposed to feel like. With very different gameplay to the regular game it somewhat complements the mode without really bringing any sort of substance or pull to play, still a good breath of fresh air. The new gameplay elements do not seem to work as poorly with Pro Clubs, since you and your friends can actually use players  defensively. Even with only some minor changes being the "party mode" of FIFA this is the most enjoyable game mode.I would seriously not recommend anyone buying the game if your main purpose would be to play Ultimate Team, if you're really interested in any other game mode, buy it at half price.

I dont expect much from the AI. I dont expect defenders to steal the ball for me. I dont expect them to not fall to a juke move. I dont expect offense to be always making a perfect run, but... even still... they barely ever do any of this. If im not in direct control of a player, theyre basically jogging everywhere. Players dont make runs unless i use the command to, and yes, i have changed tactics and whatnot. The ball will bounce around my defenders feet often and then just continue on the course the attacker had it on originally.... and omg the number of times the opponent has attackers just run up the field no coverage is scary. This game is awful. FIFA does a great job of making sure that your game will not stay in progress or that you will not have fun at any point in time. From it being impossible to intercept the ball on defense to not knowing where your pass is going to go, FIFA makes the game of soccer unpredictable in the worst ways. All you play against in ultimate team are people who spend 2000 dollars on day one to have the most broken team that is impossible to beat. Don't even get me started on the origin services that make you alt+tab out of the ongoing FIFA match you are in. (THIS HAS HAPPENED 9 TIMES OUT OF MY 40 GAMES NOW) They added some good features like being able to angle your AI in the orientation you would like by using the right stick, but that is really the blunt end of what EA has done well. If you want to pull your hair out almost every time you log onto the game and play against people who pace abuse and sweat the ball every game, this one's for you. Don't waste your time.

As a manager career mode guy I'm actually really enjoying the new stuff they put into the mode. The new training system, positional training, updated youth academy system, and the new scheduling feature are all really great additions that keep me playing more than last year's CM. Could there be more? Absolutely. But I'm having fun so I'd recommend it.That being said, I also used to enjoy player career mode as well and that mode is virtually untouched. If they updated that mode and added some elements of NBA 2k's career mode I think it would be awesome and attract a lot of new players. But I'm not holding my breath so overall, FIFA 21 is good but it's not great.

Number one question. Is FIFA21 better than FIFA20?Yes.I am a career mode player, and so this is a single player or local multi-player review. If you play FUT or online then look away now because this isn't for you.The game play does seem alot more fluid, there is a decent flow, but with that said one of the things EA bragged about were runs off the ball and for the most part the AI off the ball is awful. My AI team mates constantly point for a through ball then immediately abandon that run as I make the pass....much more so than in FIFA20.Individual flair is easier in this FIFA and I'm not sure if that is good or not. Your team can win and lose on a single players performance and with lower league teams, trying to balance winning and having a sharp team with having to use reserves is torture.I always used to play as Bury but since they went bust I play as Salford and my object or winning league two and turning a 27mil profit in season one.....reallly......Career mode so far is better than previous. I like the more random play. Interceptions and deflections seem more likely though it does make shooting from distance in open play totally useless. It seems more chaotic when you are not in control and more satisfying when you are tiki taking your way to goal and that is all well and good but there are still pitfalls. There was a moment where my defender was repelled from the ball by an unseen force and still EA denies scripting....I don't think this game deserves the hate I have had for previous instalments because they have improved career. Does it justify the price tag? That is on you as the payee

Gameplay Issue - Midfielders not tracking or providing any defensive logic.There's a big gameplay issue where midfielders do not track runs or engage in defensive duties/shape at all. '1v1' seems to be the cause. As one defender is programmed to only mark one attacker, many positional and logical problems arise. There's no contextual logic at all. I've provided many video examples with further explanation below.What happens when the bug occurs? Midfielders (and wingers, sometimes defenders also) will just stand still like they're 'switched off' and will not come across to mark logical danger. They simply just stand there and watch. The '1v1' feature brought in in FIFA 20 seems to be the cause of this. We can't micro-manage our entire team one by one to play a team sport. In the examples you'll see below, you'll see how this manifests many times throughout a match. All examples provided are on legendary difficulty also.What should be happening instead? The AI should be 'engaged' at the very least. They need to track runs and react to danger. At the moment the midfielders simply stand still and don't engage. This is not the AI 'holding our hand' at all, this is just basic football logic that the rest of your team should track runs and engage.There's a big gameplay issue with midfielders not tracking runs or engaging in defensive duties/shape at all. '1v1' seems to be the cause. As one defender is programmed to only mark one attacker many positional and logical problems arise. There's no contextual logic.

pretty much just a copy and paste of FIFA 20, FIFA 19, FIFA 18 & FIFA 17, but with added transfers and updated kits. If you want to play it for the offline career mode aspect, like i do, dont bother spending the money. Buy FIFA 20 and use the realism mod. There aren't enough changes in the offline aspect to justify it. They have introduced 'new' features that were in the game in 2015/16. They have added 'new' gameplay features that were in FIFA 2004. No seriously, FIFA 2004 had off the ball AI control and now EA are touting it as a new feature. Oh and did i mention Goalkeepers are broken, they cant save low driven shots if it was there job. The midfield is also broken, they dont track back and leave your defenders exposed. The game is basically re-skinned, given a new UI and the squads are updated, then EA dumps all of its care into Ultimate Team because thats what makes them money. Game is not worth it.

This will be my last EA purchase. I use hibernate mode on my laptop and typically do not exit the game when I put my laptop into hibernation. However, on one occasion, when I was playing SB, a glitch happened and the AI computer took over my gameplay. Not wanting to forfeit the match, I allowed the game to play out and got a victory. Shortly after, I receive an email from EA, describing how I am a cheater and got a 7 days suspension. Also, they deleted my FUT team just before un-suspending my account. So I began the long process of rebuilding my team. Note that a couple of objectives were already collected on my previous FUT team so I lose those easy objective bonuses. I could not change my team name too. Also, I lost all my pre-order bonuses. I had a long online text chat with EA and they could not do anything to help me. When I had a decent enough team, I went to play Division Rivals. That was when I met the REAL hackers. I was hit with the disconnect hack which is pretty common. See more here: https://fifaforums.easports.com/en/discussion/567414/current-state-of-playing-fifa-21-on-the-pcSo the irony of the situation is that all these hackers are getting away scot free, while me, just an average dude that wants to play a game of football on my PC gets suspended from EA with all my bonuses thrown out. Last EA purchase ever.
great game

Lite improvements in animations. Engine is still half baked. Shots at any 10 - 60 degree angle are unstoppable, reduced effectiveness of possession ball and curling shots. The FUT model is pay to win and EA still massively underpaying in in game coins for each win. Loot is still non existent for grinding, You end up having to pay money to get better, pay money to have a chance of getting a Legend. This also means FUT has major gambling levels of addictive content. This game should not be rated E at all. This needs to stop, not is it horrible game design but highly predatory in approach. Fut should be a beautiful experience where you have access to team building and playing with the greats of your choice. I've reached out to Chris Lee from the House of Representatives to investigate the style of loot boxes and EA's Fifa practices. They need to either ban this game are change the way it is designed. I don't know why lots of people said this game is the same, because it is not. You may be not aware of that but actually there are lots of differences in the game play. The game is more smooth, more easy to attack hard to defend and I've never encountered any bugs or players going through with each other. Graphics are awesome, pitches are great. Origin and steam are working perfectly with each other, no lag no fps drop and I'm playing in ultra settings,4x anti aliasing with 160 fps. You can easily find lots of players. Career mode is my favourite which has lots of new features like promoting new players to new positions or trainings, but most importantly the simulation. You can simulate the game and there are commentators to comment too! It feels like football manager which is pretty dope. There are few new features that I forgot to tell too.Also I've been playing FIFA since FIFA 2016 and this game is better than FIFA 2020 and if someone is saying that the game is too fast, you can make it slower in settings but it is not, actually its more slow than FIFA 2020 and it's just like what it has to be. I tend to buy Fifa every five years or so (Fifa '10, '15, and now '21) so this review should provide some perspective in the sea of complaints of this year's rendition being too similar to '20. I mean what do you expect? I also haven't played FUT so no complaints here about loot boxes or pay to win mechanics. Since Fifa '15, the game has improved a lot. I love the changes to Career Mode, specifically with the flexibility of simming and the more in-depth scouting, negotiations, and transfers. Volta, which is completely new to me, is also really cool and a fun - more casual - change of pace. Of course since '15 I expected a substantial improvement in graphics, which I think are there to some extent, but what's more noticeable are the dynamic animations. Player physics are great and realistic interaction with other game objects/players seems much improved. The main reason I recommend Fifa '21 is because it works. No bugs, no screen tearing, no complaints. Playing on ultra with my Gtx 1080 and no fps issues.  The AI is responsive and challenging. The soundtrack is killer.  I say go for it.

Best Fifa in 5 years (imo) I've bought every Fifa since 03 and pretty much exclusively play Career mode and online seasons. The last 2 or 3 Fifa's i've really hated the gameplay, animations especially felt very stiff and robotic and unrealistic.. plus the crossing and headers have felt 'off' for a few years now. This year it got to the point I almost didn't buy it as I thought the gameplay would be the same, after watching a few youtube videos I noticed the animations looked a bit more fluid, the pace looked more realistic and the career mode a few small tweaks that I liked IE the development plan system where you can change a players position for example a RW being coached into a CM role. I bought the game and i'm happy to say that yes the gameplay is much improved with a LOT of small tweaks ! the animations are far more varied and fluid when dribbling, crossing, shooting etc and this year you can finally head in corners and crosses and actually take volly's without them going into row z. Also FINALLY players make intelligent runs off the ball both offensively and defensively. The defending finally feels good with players challenged to position themselves well and force opposing players onto their weak foot or blocking off paths instead of the usual 'charge at them with one button and tackle.' Career mode though needing a bit more love is taking small steps in the right direction by adding training, loan to buy options, negotiating outside of transfer windows for pre-contracts and the previously mentioned development plan and youth academy.overall if you too haven't liked the last 2 or 3  Fifas like me this maybe a good time to jump back in. theres a lot of troll reviews from people that rather don't like Fifa or even don't like sports games in general saying it's the same game every year which I understand the point but also realise this isn't an RPG where you can overhaul loads of mechanics and add crazy new features it's a sports game with defined rules and what's expected so I kind of understand each year is more or less small tweaks and features rather than some complete overhaul. If you like Fifa get it, you know what you are buying it's just a better version of the last few Fifa's if you are waiting for some mystical magical complete overhaul of the whole game where there's so many changes it becomes a battle royal then.. well yeah you won't like it this year either

This FIFA is quite a change for me since the last FIFA, I last played was FIFA 19. Changes as to career mode are quite minimal but changes the aspect of training the players even better by giving you the choice to change their positions, how their play style will be (like more attacking midfielder or more play making attacker etc). Career mode also has more in-depth in club schedule like setting when the players will train, rest, and recover for their next games. Volta is now more fast paced and fun specially if you are playing with your friends in a team game. Kick-off is mostly the same just with more party modes. FUT I haven't played that much during the time of this review since I have played FUT but I never really get into it after the next 2 weeks of the games release. All the other modes I didn't talk about in this review either don't interest me or got minimal to no change at all. In conclusion FIFA 21 is a decent game if you are coming back from the 17-20 installments but if you still own 12-14 this game is not that worth it. 8/10

I just exclusively play Career Mode, so this will be more of a Career Mode review rather than the complete game.So, in terms of career mode, its the best it has ever been in along time. The sim match feature and being able to jump in mid match is certainly a great feature, but just like many things in FIFA, its an old feature that is just being brought back, I remember FIFA 11 on the PSP had this feature, but hey it's EA Sports amiright. Training feature is better this year with being able to train your entire squad regularly rather than the 5 players are just usually limited to. Transfer is more unique with at the beginning of the save you are asked if you want the transfer to be loose or strict and now CPU teams can offer to trade players, so transfer are now more unique. ATTENTION ANYONE GETTING THE ORIGIN ACTIVATION ERROR Clearing the cache of the origin client seemed to work for me.To clear the cache follow these steps: 1. If Origin is running, close it by clicking Origin in the menu bar then Exit.  Double-check that Origin is fully closed. If it isnâ€™t, you wonâ€™t be able to complete all the steps.  - To double-check, open Task Manager and go to Processes. Make sure that Origin.exe and OriginWebHelperService.exe arenâ€™t there. If they are, end the tasks to close them. 2. Hold the Windows key + R.In the command box that opens, type %ProgramData%/Origin then click OK.3. Delete all the files and folders inside it   except for LocalContent. Do not delete this folder.    4. Hold the Windows key + R again.In the command box that opens, type %AppData% then click OK.5. In the Roaming folder that opens, delete the Origin folder.6. Click on AppData in the address bar.Open the Local folder.Delete the Origin folder in there.7. Restart your PC and log back into OriginHope this helps!

Thought it was a good idea to give FIFA a try again after not buying any of the games for years, but I was terribly mistaken. Oh... the reason why I stopped buying them? The price wasn't worth ANY of the updates. Why would I pay 60-70 euros a year for just some simple kit and team changes? Oh right, Ultimate Team was receiving updates... but you know, not everyone cares about that part of the game at all, since it's just aimed at getting people to buy packs. I'm more of a career mode fan myself.FIFA 21 isn't much better than it's predecessors. Aside from the improved simulation feature in career mode, I don't think it's even better at all. But to pay the price of a full game just for a better simulation feature? Nope, that's pretty bad. Player career mode seems like a simple copy and paste from years ago, just with a few more bugs. Just buy FIFA 12 and you'll probably have a more satisfying experience.

Possibly the laziest FIFA yetI was on the fence whether to give this game a positive or negative review because honestly it just feels like FIFA20 with an update rather than a new game. But ultimately decided to give it a thumbs up because it is an improvement over the previous game and I'm sure I'll end up putting many hours into it. As primarily a FUT player, here is my experience so far. Pros:- Completion of the placement matches and promotions in Division Rivals now give coin rewards- Player fitness cards have been removed, allowing you to stick with the same team each match- Heading and crossing has been drastically improved- The overall pace of the game has been slowed down and feels better- Defending is more reliable and mistakes seem slightly less commonCons:- Practically no new features- Many of the interfaces look identical to FIFA20- Graphics haven't been improved in any meaningful way- Commentators are as bland as ever, with many of the soundbites being taken directly from FIFA20- Price OverallThe gameplay feels more realistic and balanced and the removal of fitness cards makes team management easier. But the lack of innovation makes it really hard to justify the Â£55 price tag. If you're a big FIFA fan or are looking to get into the series, the game is fun enough and is probably worth getting. But if you're looking for anything beyond what we saw last year, it's not worth the money.RATING: 6/10

Activation Problems? Step 1: Open help.ea.comStep 2: Click Logon to your Origin Account on EA Help page.Step 3: Click Login with Steam account. Using this your Origin Account and Steam account will be linked and synchronised.Step 4: Open Origin Launcher. Refresh your Game library. FIFA 21 Would be in your library now.Step 5: Now, Launch FIFA 21 from steam. Now it won't require Activation.

So, ill start with what annoys me already. 10.10,2020. Players still do not have proper minifaces. Cavani with none is a joke, van de Beek with Ajax's miniface from last year. What is this? Did EA not have enough time for little details? Game is Fifa20.5 and I was ready for that. Just like everyone. But screwing up with easiest things? Really? What next? Gonna forget to add Messi's miniface? Cant wait to play Barcelona with 11 grey, empty faces in career screen. Young, most proliffic players still with no real faces? Greenwood? Odegaard? Fati? Diaby? They have potential close to 90, THEY WILL BE USED by players and you know that. But we get real faces for 50 overall players in none-knows-what leagues. Im sure Career mode players like me are all happy about that. I wont waste time to whine about same, annoying main menu or slight changes that could be invented 5 years ago - some of them were available 10 years ago, then deleted so could be "invented" again. Just no.After 7hours - because steam asked if i changed my mind - No. Still negative. Same game menu since 2017? Works slower in every next fifa - however its appearance stays exactly the same so how does it work? Give old stuff and make it eat more resources? -  which discourages me to even start the game. Gameplay is ripped off from fira20 - who would have thought - but playing matches is still quite enjoyable. Yet it was enjoyable in fifa17,19,20 - I have them all - aswell so if someone just want to kick the ball - stick to... 19? Was good enough. But I'm career mode player and I simulate 80% of the matches so if menu works slow, game works slow, progress is slow... Season takes twenty hours instead of few and i kinda enjoy to finish season in two days. Come back from work, play a season, buy new player or two, have fun. Nope, DO IT SLOW. Positive things r manual trainings. Do them once, all others u can simulate and get highest manually achieved rating - cool, i like it. However trainings r retarded cos game chooses players by itself and u have change it all by urself in very annoying way. For example - u have shooting training but game automatically chooses three defenders to do it. Wanna change it? Feel free but first u have to make sure players u want to choose r not selected in any other training session. Takes 10-15min to do that with all players. Really? Simple code would be sufficient to pick offensive players for offensive training sessions automatically. Nope, too hard. Negotiations with other managers? Whateva. They still dont rly care about new things added to game. After 5 transfer windows they sent me swap deal once. ONCE. So what r we talking about?  it almost does not exist. Also - what annoys me extremaly - u cant convince player to accept lower squad role than he wants. U just cant. In old Fifas u could give him more money and ask to be freaking prospect - No problem. Deal. Just pay me 200k. Fifa21 - NO. Im 34 years old player, but my stats r quite high so important or Crucial. Wanna give me more money? Sure, but still important or crucial. And like i said - it was already available long, long ago. Sumamry - I see nice things in fifa21 but this game should literally be DLC to fifa20... For 25% of its price. Dont buy. Dont waste ur money if u r casual player. After 7 hours i simply uninstalled the game and i regret every penny i spent on it. BTW. 14.10,2020 Still no Cavani face. RIP.21,10,2020 After a week wih bald career mode managers new update fixed... nothing. 1,1gb patch that changed literally nothing that could affect ingame bugs. They invented more.
â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ you EA

You know the drill.If you enjoyed the gameplay of previous Fifa games then you'll have a good time here and vice versa. As for ultimate team the story stays the same. You will find it very hard going up against those that pour money into this game right at the beginning. However, from what I've seen, getting a decent team at the beginning doesn't take too long due to coins being much easier to attain through objectives and rivals etc. You simply need to find cheap players with decent stats for their rating (I would recommend building a Serie A team should you want to save some dosh).Bugs and glitches didn't happen to me very often. I only really saw them in the Volta gamemode and training sessions though your experience may vary.The pricing in my opinion is honestly quite fair considering the amount of time you will probably pour into this game (Trust me grinding is needed should you want that sweet sweet ultimate team. Then again you have to bear in mind that you are essentially paying for what is an update on the previous game so if you simply want a solid football game and do not care about ultimate team then I would not recommend you to make the purchase. Overall just your standard Fifa game from EA. You probably already know by now if your going to buy it or not.
g

Cons: - The size of the ball, as nitpicking as it sounds. Since FIFA 17 the ball is about 15% smaller than it should be -- compare to a real football broadcast and like me you will never "unsee" it again. Say what you want, but for me it's an immersion breaking issue.- Non intuitive defence mechanics, as always. "Contain" and "teamate contain" are just a waste of two buttons, as they are totally useless. WTH.- Custom controller settings simply vanish sometimes, so it's necessary to configure it all over again, and again.- Exagerated production focus on the infamous FUT.- Last but not least: I began to play FIFA in 2009 and since then every edition (except 2010 World Cup) keeps the same problem: it's way easier to win as visitor against the AI. I just can't stand this. Dear EA: it's the other way around, guys.Pros:+ Attacking is easy and fluid.+ Presentation, as usual.+ You can turn off the music.+ Unlike PES, manual replays are well done.+ In-game visuals.+ The crowd and general stadia atmosphere.+ Licenses.+ TV broadcast feeling.

I just exclusively play Career Mode, so this will be more of a Career Mode review rather than the complete game.So, in terms of career mode, its the best it has ever been in along time. The sim match feature and being able to jump in mid match is certainly a great feature, but just like many things in FIFA, its an old feature that is just being brought back, I remember FIFA 11 on the PSP had this feature, but hey it's EA Sports amiright. Training feature is better this year with being able to train your entire squad regularly rather than the 5 players are just usually limited to. Transfer is more unique with at the beginning of the save you are asked if you want the transfer to be loose or strict and now CPU teams can offer to trade players, so transfer are now more unique. Being able to change a player's position is also neat, and being able to improve their weak foot and skill moves is also good.I want to praise them, but then again a lot of these are just easy things they could've added yearssss ago. We all know these are not new ideas, there are already millions of videos on these things from years ago.Oh and as for gameplay, its FIFA, you really expecting many changes there? Other than the ability to change the direction of the player making a run. It's not much different. Perhaps I can say that while FIFA 20 was very defensive, this is a bit quicker and scoring goals is so much easier, for better or for worse, you decide.In conclusion I give it a "meh". But because its steam I'll give it a thumbs up I guess.*edit: I want to add that they really need to improve the midifeld defending. When defending the midfield just stands there forcing me to pull defenders breaking up the line. They really need to fix this up.

The fact that EA - to no surprise - charges full price for this half-finished, buggy game is beyond me. This, more so than any other FIFA, feels like a roster update rather than a "new" - quotation marks because there is only so much you can do with a football game - iteration of FIFA. Where are the third kits for teams like Arsenal, Manchester United, etc? Why are there so many bugs in every game-mode? Where is Leeds' stadium Elland Road? Save your money and do NOT spend $60-80 on this game. This game has become recycled garbage that tricks you into spending a lot of money on something that will be useless next year. Not worth it. It makes me sad because I love football and I feel like there are so many possibilities and features that they could add to make modes like career mode - both player and manager - more realistic and life-like, yet they put all of their resources into FIFA Ultimate Team because it is the one game-mode that exploits the naive and gullible minds of gambling addicts and children. Boycott EA until they actually serve us something worth while.

It's Fifa, you know what you're getting into. A fun football simulator/arcade game that is very much overpriced when the developers misunderstand content for more skins in a lootbox.Basically no innovation each year, due to a small development window with all the effort poured into their money maker FUT... (can't really blame them for that, money makes the world go around), but their monopolisation over the football licence means that we have no other options if you're craving a football game. If you're looking for a simplified manager mode, then Fifa has that, but don't expect any kind of depth to the gamemode. If you're looking for a complex and engaging manager mode simulator, look at Football Manager Series.Bit of shame that the game requires an origin login, but then again, it has the same thing on the consoles and this is nothing new, with lots of companies building drm logins to combat piracy etc.TldR - If you're expecting a revolutionary football title, you won't find it in Fifa. Until some real competition enters the market, which is difficult when EA own the majority of the football licenses (proven by PES). If you want to try the game before purchasing, I recommend that you use the EA Play trial.

I have done nothing but play this game for the last three days and I am happy with it so far. I find that I am really enjoying ultimate team again. Last year I fell out of love with it by November because EA decided to hand things out to people (icons). I think it is going to be a very good year for Fifa, maybe almost good enough to redeem for last years rubbish. In terms of gameplay it is fun. I find that the goalkeepers are better this year however EA need to decrease the likelihood of an across goal shot going in. I would say that some players are still trying to abuse the fast cards and it can be agitating. I personally like to build up some play and then score a good goal. By doing this I find the gameplay comes out more smooth. The transfer market this Fifa is once again all over the place, but not as bad as previous games. I think a good example would be 80 rated Saint-Maximan, he costs $70,000 coins whereas a whole Bundesliga team of 84 and 85 rated cards costs that much. Something that I have seen content creators praise is the fact that we get coins off of our rivals placement matches. I too love it. I think if you can win at least three games which would give you $64,000 coins then you should be happy. It allows us Fifa players to create a usable team from the start. My advice would be to invest this into the advanced SBC's as you will only make a profit. I think EA deserve praise for their improvements. I highly recommend this game.NOTE:If you have any questions just leave a comment and I will answer it when I see it.

I personally enjoyed this year's FIFA more than the previous one for a lot of reasons, But let's not lie to ourselves. This whole FIFA franchise has a lot of issues that needs to be addressed, Let's start with the pros and cons of FIFA 21Pros:- The game is well optimized and runs smoothly, In my case i have a high end PC (RTX 2080/Ryzen 9 3900X) and the game works stable and fine at 1440p@60fps (i limited it at 60fps)- Steam and Origin uses the same server for online play which is good for playerbase- Dribbling is now harder to prevent people from spamming dribbles, And some skill moves are now slower- It's now harder to defend which is a good thing so there will be a skill gap between good/average/newbie players- FUT Improvements: They removed Fitness Cards, CO-OP mode in FUT, You can now play friendlies with your FUT Team, New Menus, Improved Stadium Customizations- Updates comes first on PCCons:- Fast players are so much overpowered this year- Goal keepers are still bad- No story mode this year (Like the story mode Journey that was included in FIFA 17 and FIFA 19- Outdated graphics (feels like a 2014-2016 game)Cons (Of only PC version):- Next-Gen Graphics are not coming to this year's PC version unfortunately, FIFA 21 uses the same version released on PS4 and Xbox One- Origin is required to launch the Steam version, This is the case for most EA games and it's a shame.- the PC version has unfortunately some cheaters, And EA anti-cheat is really bad, All you can do for now when you meet a cheater is to report him to EA- PC Players cannot qualify for competitive esports tournamentsConclusion:- If you are a football fan and you don't mind an arcadey game, You will have a lot of fun with this FIFA- If you are a football fan and you want the best football simulation, Your best bet is to go with PES- If you are a football fan and you want Next-Gen graphics, You either wait for FIFA 22/PES 2022 on PC, Or buy FIFA 21 on PS5/XSX/XSS

They improved career mode a lot which is always something good to see. However, as a PC player who puts the movement keys as the arrow keys (because that's most convenient) every time I play the game and use the arrow keys to move the game plans get changed. I tried every method to fix this but it seems that the keys for switching game plans are fixed in FIFA21. So as much as I want to give a positive rating for the career mode improvements I'm gonna have to give yet another negative rating for this game. Please fix this and allow switching game plans to another key.

I would recommend this game to returning players (like me) who played older Fifa (last played Fifa 14), but for other, I believe the phrase is 'just a paid annual update'.As someone who has played fifa offline (and probably will be doing so with this version as well) with friends and family, I see a lot of small quality changes in terms of  gameplay on field which amount to quality footballing experience as compared to the last fifa I played (like players used to lose momentum when receiving an air ball in earlier version. I am still discovering small stuffs like these in every match I play).Also, people having stuttering issues/slow motion into paced gameplay, what I did was changed Fifa setting to lock to 60fps  (other settings set to high/ultra) and in Nvidia control panel, I changed V-Sync setting to be controlled by the 3D application for Fifa and the stuttering stopped and it works like charm now. **This solution may not work for all.**All in all, I am happy with Fifa 21 and enjoying a lot.

As with every FIFA the game itself is simple enough to pick up and play but this year there is a focus on giving you an array of tools that will allow you to hone your style of play. The hope, we assume, is to make gameplay more varied and metas harder to come by. Inevitably the community will settle on preferred tactics and styles but FIFA 21 allows a more intelligent approach, particularly at an elite level.+ So many modes to play+ Career Mode is decent finally+ Hyper-realistic gameplay+ Volta Football is still a great mode

As of October 31, the matchmaking servers are horrible. When i got the game 2 weeks ago. I used to have between 15 ping and 20 ping max! As of now i get 30 min up to 70 and i am from the east coast. The game is unplayable specially in Division one rivals where its very competitive. I strongly suggest to get this game on sale because it is not worth 90$. Apart from horrible lag, the game improved last year from the creativity point of view for the side. From the defensive side, its way more manual witch requires more timing and so more skills.
